Reviews.Title: “Great location, trains in the hotel ate a nice touch”
Reviews.Author: hapeit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right by the conference center and Lucas stadium. It is a bit dated and I had mixed results with the staff on customer service. I would stay here again for the location and hope that some items improve, but it is still OK for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks!”
Reviews.Author: pensio2000ishorrible
Reviews.Content: Did a priceline for a great deal....asked to stay in a train car....I travel often for business...this was way outside of the normal boring hotel...A+

Reviews.Title: “A place for HEAVY sleepers.”
Reviews.Author: TravelinWIGal
Reviews.Content: The hotel definitely makes it clear that they are on an active train line, which I didn't think would be a big deal for me, as I'm a heavy sleeper. I was here for three nights and each night was jolted awake in the middle of night by a train creating noise and vibrations. On the first night I seriously it was an earthquake. Other notes about my room, it a mix of 90s and early 2000s decor. The clock was a Sony dreammachine, wow...flashback, who travels with CDs anymore? There was ONE available plug in the room...not ideal for a modern society's outlet needs and I was alone, couldn't imagine if I had the family along. And final piece of historic decor was the heat lamp in bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “A let down”
Reviews.Author: kiwifuz
Reviews.Content: I am just going to be honest here; I just do not get all of the positive reviews. I think the only "five" I could give this hotel has to do with service. This is not a bad hotel, but there is nothing great about it. It is probably my least favorite hotel in the immediate downtown Indianapolis-area. Yes, I understand that this hotel is a historic building. My issue is that “historic” is not an excuse to allow a hotel to look worn and shabby. Both the Omni Severin and Canterbury nearby are old, yet (even with actual small rooms) the places have been recently remodeled. With Indianapolis hosting the Super Bowl one would think all of the hotels would step it up a notch, not the Crowne Plaza! The staff at this hotel is great. The valets, front desk staff, and the older man offering assistance from a podium by the front door could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Location wise, while this hotel is a bit further south than some others, it is convenient coming from the south. Since the hotel is located as far south as it is, you do not really deal with the congestion and one-way street issues encountered at other hotels. (Just drive up Illinois and take a left immediately after you emerge from under the viaduct.) I liked the location because of the proximity to Circle Centre Mall, Pan Am Plaza, restaurants, and the highway. It was easy enough to walk to Monument Circle from this hotel for our group. Sure, there are hotels closer to everything, but there are worse “downtown” locations, too (by the canal, up by IUPUI, way east- all of these are considered downtown but are not as close to the action). We used the valet service to park our car, but self-parking at Pan Am Plaza was just north of the hotel. (I was not really fond of the hotel not having its own self-parking, but since the location is what/where it is, that is how it works. The cost at Pan Am plaza varies based on events happening downtown, which is not necessarily at issue at hotels with their own parking.) We stayed in a “normal” room (#277), not a train car room. The room itself is the usual size and overlooks the pool. It has a normal-sized bathroom, two double beds (no way queens would fit unfortunately), a small table to hold a suitcase, dresser with a stone top & a flat screen TV, and a small table with two chairs. I would say that our room was on par with your typical Crowne Plaza/Holiday Inn room size, amenity, and set-up wise. You can tell this is not an older hotel, just an old building converted into a hotel (no tiny bathroom, tiny rooms, etc.; as you will find nearby). I thought the bed was comfortable. I also appreciated that it was double sheeted. The reason I give this hotel poor marks is because of obvious issues: First: This hotel needs to be remodeled. If the owners/management company is not prepared to do that, then it at least needs a good cleaning and sprucing up. Sorry but I find caving in tub surround tiles, rusty drips, peeling wallpaper, gunk around the bathroom door stop, dirty windows, stained dust ruffles, broken switch plate covers, etc. unacceptable. It just tells me that with some TLC this hotel could be great. Instead, it’s not. I would not put this on a level with hotels that are dirty, but it is not really that clean either. Second: This hotel needs some soundproof windows. I needed to keep the fan to the climate control system running to drown out some of the sounds around the pool. I can not imagine what rooms on the first floor are like. On the second floor, we constantly heard people around the pool. There are things that can be done with windows to lessen the sound transmission. Unless you stay up late and wake up early, I guess try to avoid any of the rooms that overlook the pool. Third: I could hear everything in the rooms above and next to ours (on the bed side of the room). All morning I heard the people upstairs talking, their kid running around, toys pushed across the floor, laughing, etc. At night and the next morning, I could hear the people next door. In the bed closest to the bathroom, I could hear our neighbor in the bathroom. Not cool. The problem is, I do not think that thin walls & floors/ceilings are fixable in a remodel. Fourth: The bathroom is at the level of an old Holiday Inn. Peeling and ill-fitting wallpaper, plastic counter top, tile walls around the tub caving in, etc. Totally fixable. Actually, with some serious cleaning, tolerable. Instead, barely clean but not competitive with other hotels downtown. IF this hotel is remodeled I MIGHT stay here again. Otherwise, I will probably avoid it. For $25/night more, we could/should have stayed at the Marriott. It is a bit further west, but it is a much nicer hotel. If I could get this hotel really cheap after a remodel, I might just bring earplugs and try to deal with it. Nevertheless, probably not. If this hotel was not priced similarly to other, nicer, more recently remodeled hotels, I might say the value is better. There is not enough that is redeeming about this hotel to make me want to stay there again. I would not recommend this hotel to friends staying downtown either; I would direct them just about anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: Kim S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights due to our sons hockey tournament downtown. I was not surprised by the price for the room but I thought it would have a bit more. It's was a basic holiday inn size double bedroom but with no microwave or mini-fridge. When we arrived a hose was laying in the bathroom with a bunch of dirt laying in the bathtub. We had to take our truck and tried to parkin the underground structure. Well the truck wouldn't fit so I had to valet my truck wich wa 27 per day, ok no big deal right? Except that the valet was parking on the street right in front of the hotel. If you're going to pay for valet it should be a covered area after all it's 27 per day. We were given two passes for breakfast which was a bummer but what really pissed me off was that we had to pay a extra 14 dollars for the kids to eat at a very minimal breakfast. Just to let you know any juice is not included in your free breakfast which included under cooked scrambled eggs, french toast, grits, biscuits and gravy, small danishs, cartons of milk you can get at school for lunch, muffins and bagels, that's it. Ohh wait the milk was for the small selection of cereal. The trains weren't that bad at first, but the second night we woke up at 1200 am to what sounded like a train de-railing for about 10 mins. If you stay on the north side of the hotel you should be ok though.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - Great Service - across the street from Lucas Oil Stadium”
Reviews.Author: jamiebrook1973
Reviews.Content: we were greeted at the hotel by a very helpful gentlemen who helped us with our luggage and into the hotel. The front desk staff was very informative and the hotel itself is very tastefully decorated. The train cars that you rent are really cool! Great for Kids! The best part about this hotel was that it was across the road from Lucas Oil and you can actually walk through the Convention center and never go outside. The restaurant had really good breakfast as well!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy & Classic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: hoteldiva05
Reviews.Content: Overall great experience. EXCELLENT location!! Very creative hotel, built around train theme and station.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, antique, and utterly charming...”
Reviews.Author: VijogeJoliet_ILUSA
Reviews.Content: I booked this property for the weekend as a surprise Christmas gift for my train-loving husband. If a man can be "tickled pink", he was! I had reserved a train car room, of course, and requested the Charlie Chaplin Room at check-in. I just love the decor of this room. Our king bed had the softest of linens-so comfy. Our mattress was equally soft-not so comfy for my back. . and the fiberfill pillows had quite a bit of "bounce" to them, which I didn't care for at all. (I should know by now to take my down pillows from home.) The hotel is huge, and we explored from one end of the other-top to bottom. It's quite wonderful to see. The carpet in the lobby is really cool and colorful, but the furnishings are a bit dated and worn. They could definitely use some new chairs,or at least reupholster the ones they have. Valet parking was $27 per night, but I now know that if you're travelling on a weekend you can park on the street (just a few steps from the valet area) for free, but I imagine you need to get there early. We didn't use the pool, hot tub, or restaurant/bar, so I can't comment about those. Someone commented in a previous review that they received two free drink coupons for each night of their stay but we didn't get those so I don't think it's something to count on. Would have been nice, though. I would definitely like to return, maybe in a bit warmer weather. Downtown Indy has a lot to offer. I think I want the John Phillip Sousa room next time...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: offshore64
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. Location is right downtown so very convenient to restaraunts - walking. Rooms are clean and what you'd expect. Staff is helpful. Easy access to highway so getting where you need to be for business is not stressful. Parking is $20/night

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience :)”
Reviews.Author: Licorish
Reviews.Content: For my husbands birthday Cinco de Mayo I decided to recreate our first five dates one of which was a stay in the Union Station Hotel for our 1 year anniversary in St. Louis... so I was ELATED to get the room at the Crowne Plaza Union Station for less than $60 on priceline as a random pick. The room was great, across the hall from the train that is in the lobby like area. Very nice and clean yet simple amenities. For the price no complaints on my end. Also the staff was EXTREMELY knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. I think this may be an annual tradition, I would rate my stay a 8.5 on a scale 1-10. It would be a 10 if the room were a bit more updated.

Reviews.Title: “One time is enough for me..”
Reviews.Author: Heathdatravelista
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here Saturday night, after travels from Marion Indiana for a graduation. We could have stayed anywhere but decided to stay downtown to experience Indy. Staying at the Crowne Plaza didn't really give us the " Indy" experience. Yeah, the hotel is an old train station which is pretty neat... But it's so dark and kind of creepy actually. The room itself was very plain and boring. Very Clean BUT we could have gotten the same thing at a Holiday Inn and that would have come with free breakfast!! Parking was also $22 but that's expected when staying downtown I guess.. Next time we will try a 4 star..Maybe that will give us what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Sammsays
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful in every way, from Cindy at the Pullman Bar to Mike at the front desk, I can't wait to go back! We stayed in one of the train car rooms and loved it. The hotel was clean and the food in the hotel restaurant was really good. Thank you Crown Plaza for a fantastic vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Please update soon.”
Reviews.Author: INMS
Reviews.Content: I and my wife reserved a reservation from Wednesday, November 30, - Saturday, December 3, 2011. We arrived late Wednesday but had no problem checking into the Crown. We were greeted with a smile and provided our room keys. The hotel interior design is nice especially with the train’s cars rooms. The hotel is in the process of room renovation which is a good thing. Some issues were the bathroom lights fixtures were separated from the wall and dust was present. Our room was near the train tracks and was a little noisy when some trains pulled into the station. The restaurant was overpriced for breakfast and the food was average at best. I have stayed at other Crown properties and this was the worst. I suggest you talk with the Crown hotel in Seattle, Washington. They are top notch and the standard to shoot towards for excellent.

Reviews.Title: “This place is in dire need of a major renovation and some housekeeping!”
Reviews.Author: Fatboy1954
Reviews.Content: Poorly kept ! Dated! No safes in rooms! When was the last renovation? Many things broke or in need of renovation and general curb appeal is bad. Smoking allowed by the front door so ashes everywhere by the front door. Generally dirty at front door, one of which wouldn't open all the way. Closet door off the track, lightbulb burnt out, tub wouldn't drain. Dated bath tile and countertop. However, room was clean, bed decent and pillows terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has a unique atmosphere, rooms are average.”
Reviews.Author: Kabecka
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night over the Thanksgiving weekend. We were attending a game at Lucas Oil Stadium for the high school football playoffs, it was no more than a 5 minute walk. The hotel is cute with statues featuring people boarding the train and such. There are sleeper cars available for about double the rate ($209 the front desk told us), each with a different theme. We saw the P.T. Barnum and Charlie Chaplin cars, both very unique. I would consider staying in them in the future. Our room was average, nothing special, with a view of an ugly lot despite asking for a nicer room for a special anniversary. The bed was pretty comfortable. The exercise room was fairly nice with a nice variety of equipment. They give you a little "care" package when you get to your room...ear plugs (for the trains that go by that you can hear), an eye mask and some lavender sleep spray to spray the room/linens. We received 2 complimentary drinks at the Pullman Restaurant/Bar. We were disappointed to have last call around midnight. Parking is $27 a night at the hotel which seems a little pricey for Indy, you may want to check out public parking. Overall, this was a nice stay but I'd recommend staying in a sleeper car or looking for something a little more upscale in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel---terrible restaurant”
Reviews.Author: herephishy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Check in was efficient. There was a huge convention going on at the time, so there were tons of young people around. The hotel itself is quite unique and the set up is different seeing how it's converted train station. The room was ok. Could definitely use some updates. Bathroom just didn't seem clean, but I think that's because it needed some updates. The carpet as well. The beds were doubles. Would have preferred queens (or even better a king) but we were traveling with kids so we had to take the 2 bed option and all they had was doubles. Beds were comfortable.The walls between the rooms (trust me as we had some noisy/busy neighbors). You can definitely hear the vibration of the trains passing through but it wasn't that disruptive. Valet and bell service was prompt, although paying $27/night for valet seems like a lot, maybe not for a big city though. Saw the pool, but didn't swim. The restaurant left a lot to be desired. The menu was small, the service was slow, and the food was not good. The hamburger was way overcooked (x2). Prices were really high too. Consider walking a few blocks in either direction and eat some where else. Just make sure you make reservations as the waits were long on a Sat. night.

Reviews.Title: “You either love it or hate it”
Reviews.Author: Ottavian
Reviews.Content: It was my third stay in this hotel. The hotel is located in an old railway station, pretty close to the working rail line. You either love this hotel or hate it. The rooms are either in railway wagons converted to hotel or there are "normal" rooms with windows opening to the hotel atrium. Only a few rooms at the side of the hotel have windows to the outside world. The hotel is well maintained. The crew is very polite, friendly and helpful. However, if you want to communicate with some maids, knowledge of Spanish would significantly help. There is a swimming pool there and also a very decent exercise room. The major issue with this hotel is the rumbling noise of trains coming through the "live" train line in the night. It is really a six o'clock alarm every morning. The bad news is that you cannot switch it off. If you cannot stand this alarm, ask that your room be located in the part of the hotel which is over the reception, and not the one which close to the railway. I slept on both sides of the hotel and the location does make a significant difference. Tip1: If you are Priority Club member, you will get a set of free tickets for drinks in the hotel bar. One per day of your stay. If you are not a member, just enrol when you check in and you will get your tickets. Tip2: The hotel was recently connected by a skywalk passage to Circle Centre Mall, through the new Convention Centre. It is a really long walk, however. You can get lost several times when searching your way. But in the case of bad weather you can make it without going outside. Wintertime you can just have a sweater on you and you can leave your winter coat in the hotel room. You can go shopping and eating without stepping out. In summary: it is a decent hotel in downtown Indy. Particularly good if you feel nostalgic about trains.

Reviews.Title: “What a Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Joe G
Reviews.Content: When booking, I knew nothing about the unique architecture and history of this hotel. What a surprise I discovered to witness how cleverly the hotel had been structurally weaved between, in and around the old Train Station. The preserved sleeper cars were like a step back in time. To top off the experience, the entire staff was professional, enthusiastic and helpful. My room was extraordinarily spacious. It was a delightful stay. albeit for just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Different, pricey and really not worth it...staff is rude.”
Reviews.Author: Jake122683
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Crowne Plaza Indianapolis for a wedding. Overall, the hotel was pretty nice. It is connected to Lucas Oil Stadium and close to many downtown locations, but not as close as I have been before. This is the third hotel I have stayed at in Indianapolis recently and I have to say it ranked third, especially for the price. This is for a number of reasons. First, the place was extremely expensive, even with the group discount. For what we paid, we should have gotten a little more. Secondly, while at the wedding, a Crowne Plaza staff member called my wife a "b word". I am not sure why as we are always very kind. I think it was because my wife was not done with her meal and the lady was ready to clean the tables. Whatever the case may be, it was inexcusable and a shocking lack of respect. We were there to have a fun time and did not make a big deal about it as to distract from the wedding. That said, I know Crowne Plaza reads these reviews and I hope that this gets back to them. The rooms are pretty nice and feature a small lcd tv. The pool was nice. I did not hear one train, but then again, we were on the green train car side and that might have been why. It was not small as some suggested. I found the uniqueness of the hotel to be a plus. Maybe that is why the place was so pricey...paying for ambiance?

Reviews.Title: “Unique atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Ben_Richards
Reviews.Content: Ever get that home away from home feeling when staying at a hotel? Me neither. But the Crowne Plaza in downtown Indianapolis has been the closest thing. The hotel is rich with local history and has an ambience unlike anywhere else I have stayed. Strategically located downtown, and for the price is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Have not stayed there yet, but alreaday dissappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Erica A
Reviews.Content: I have run many races in the heart of downtown Indy and have stayed at the Marriott, the Westin, etc. and have always been very happy. Even though they have not been the host sight they have always been very accommidating w/ a late check out so that we can shower after the race. I just called to request a late checkout and the girl said I would just have to call that morning to see if we can check out late. I told her this would not be ideal since the race events start at 7:30am and if we need to be out we need to know ahead of time. She said that I could not find out early so I asked for the manager. She just kept going back and forth between me and the manager. I had to ask three times before she would transfer me. Then the manager would only offer a late check out for a $25 fee he said due to the Colts playing on Sunday (two days after out stay). I wish I had not booked w/ them b/c the other downtown hotels always gave us every request we had w/ no problems and actually acted like they did want our business. I felt like the Crowne Plaza didn't really care if we use them or not.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: EffinIllini
Reviews.Content: After having some issues with a different hotel I used Hotwire to get a great rate for 4 rooms at the Crown Plaza. We had a good stay and the location worked out great for our group as it was within walking distance to the restaurants and bars of downtown Indy. The rooms were clean and the check-in and out process went smoothly. We also appreciated the ticket for a free drink in the bar. I have stayed here previously (also getting the rooms through Hotwire) an have never had an issue with this hotel. It's a fine place to stay in downtown Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but no windows, and horrible train noise at night”
Reviews.Author: Mark Gr.
Reviews.Content: This is a truly bizarre hotel. It's built into a historic train repair depot. I guess if you're a train fan, this is the place for you. As a business traveler -- not so much. None of the rooms have windows to the outside. The typical room has a window to an interior atrium area. If you're on a 1st floor room, as I was, you have to really keep you curtains clipped shut (they provide a clip) or people are going to be able to see in. The hotel's promotional material in the restaurant talks about something like the "gentle rumblings" of the trains and the working rail line. What they really mean is an earthquake-like feeling and noise that will wake you multiple times during the middle of the night. You know that Bruce Springsteen song about waking up like a freight train running through the middle of your head. That's the experience here. I was awakened at least three times each night by really loud train noises. The glasses on my counter were shaking and clinking. I would NEVER consider staying here again for business travel. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, historic building and great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Whitleywalker
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a comfortable stay at the Crowne Plaza, which was important since we were in town for medical treatment. I enjoyed the historic building (train station) in which this hotel resides. I appreciated the fact that the Crowne Plaza is linked into the downtown skywalk since it rained during most of our stay. The king-bed was very comfortable, room was clean and had linens of nice quality. I found the fitness center to be better than most I have tried. Staff was always very friendly and helpful. The only thing I could have wanted was access to the parking garage without having to go outside in the rain. I did read of others' complaints about the train noise, but I enjoy train travel and actually found it a little charming!

Reviews.Title: “Clean,comfortable,unique what more could you want from a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SDFAN080
Reviews.Content: I read multiple reviews about this hotel before I decided to stay hear. All the negative stuff about the train noise and virbration, blah, blah ,blah. My room was on the third floor I felt train vibration, but there really was no train noise, the noise comes from inconsiderate guests who slam doors and think that yelling in the hall ways is acceptable. That can happen in any hotel. My king bed was very comfortable, my bathroom was large and clean, shower pressure was a little lacking. My room was cleaned promptly each day. I had breakfast twice in the Pullman restaurant the buffet is average at best powdered eggs and rock hard biskets. Order off the menu the food is much better, you get actual eggs. Had a burger in the bar one night was very good. Unless you stay in a five star hotel....hotel food is hotel food, besides there are multiple food options within walking distance in downtown Indy. Parking for 27.00 a night is a little expensive, add the valet tip and it's really 30+ a day. unlimited in and out might make it worth it if you are site seeing. I did not stay in the train cars but if I come back I will looks very cool, if you have kids that like trains what a great experience. Fitness room is small with lots of equipment however, seemed odd they had the treadmills and bikes facing away from the TV's , even the though they had smaller separate screens on them, I prefer to run with my head up rather than looking down a a 6 inch screen. All in all I would stay here again, especially for convensions Brel attaches to convension center via skywalk and it's right across the street from Lucas Oil Stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit... just as bad...”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysAMomFirst
Reviews.Content: No spiders this time but still a nightmare. Dirty floors in the bathroom, towels with ragged edges.. not great for a hotel but I could deal with it! However, getting locked out of your room for hours not a great exprience. After a couple days of having problems with my key.. traded it several times for new ones... finally third night it stopped working all together, after third trip downstairs for a new key to try they sent me back again with a member of the maintenance team. My stuff locked in the room and me locked out of my room! After a long waiting period in the hallway late at night he finally got the door open, but it was broke so I had to pack and move to another room. Manager apologized and moved me to another room... figured he would make it a nicer room after that problem... NOPE! Room was smaller, about half the size and trains ran past my window all night! I begged our event organizer to find a better location next year! Even the team members that stayed in the train cars were complaining about room size, hard beds, noise (train whistles) and shower height.

Reviews.Title: “Historic charm with Hoosier comfort”
Reviews.Author: HoosierGirl522
Reviews.Content: We stay here regularly for the Colts games and downtown shopping. The convenience of walking 'inside' to the Lucas Oil Stadium is worth the stay alone. There is a relaxed, very comfortable atmosphere in this historic gem of a train station/hotel. How often have you had had the pleasure of seeing old train cars inside a hotel, let alone sleep in one of them? The noise of the trains that pass through, never have bothered us, it just makes us appreciate the nostalgia of the place.. just wish these walls could speak. Stay here if you want a night to remember and talk about for years to come. We find this to be a hotel we can rely on to get all the comforts of home, at a reasonable price. It is also very enjoyable to sit next to the wall of windows in the bar/restaurant area and watch all the street activity. The food and service here is very good! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Unique”
Reviews.Author: MkBibble
Reviews.Content: As mentioned by another reviewer below, I had NO idea what a neat place I was getting. I attended a convention, and was just happy that I was able to get a room that was adjacent to the convention center; I later learned that they are connected via a walkway. The room was clean, quiet and well kept; I expected that. The staff was very attentive; I expected that as well. What I didn't expect was the very unique utilization of the old train station. From the three story lobby, complete with steel girders and figurines, to the room that are in actual rail cars (not mine, maybe next time), I have never seen anything like it. The only SLIGHT mark, on an otherwise perfect stay, was the slow service at breakfast. As is often the case, the restaurant was overwhelmed at breakfast. It appears that there were only two waiters on duty. Ours did an admirable job of trying to keep up, but ultimately the service was slow and spotty. This would CERTAINLY not keep me from returning! If you find yourself in downtown Indy. Be sure to check this one out!

Reviews.Title: “An incredible gem in the heart of old Indy”
Reviews.Author: Mbro627
Reviews.Content: I traveled on business to Indianapolis with colleagues and had no idea what a great hotel at which I would be staying!! Just walking into the lobby was breathtaking (and I HAVE stayed at many very fine hotels!). This is a hotel which was, effectively, created from an old classic train station (Union Station--are ALL train stations called Union Station?) and the metamorphosis was VERY well done! The atrium area allows you to look up to 2nd floor and balcony and is very well decorated. The hotel also encompasses what used to be the large open train station area. What did they do with THAT area? They not only created some posh sitting and walking areas but, created very nice rooms built into TRAIN CARS!! What a cool concept. While I did NOT have one of these rooms, they were a joy to see. In certain areas they have statues of "train porters" and other classic characters and "poses" from a train station of a bygone era. Talk about recycling and creating something grand from something old and no onger used!! Wow!! The room was large and comfortable and service was very good. Stay here! Stay here! Stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for football, conventions, bars and restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: twin123185
Reviews.Content: First time I have stayed here and was very happy. Located downtown adjacent to the convention center and closest good hotel to new Colt's stadium and within walking distance to many restaurants, bars and nightclubs. Located at old train station they also have real train cars as rooms. Regular rooms clean and roomy. Everyone friendly, will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly, as always”
Reviews.Author: jimmythec1
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this Hotel at least 10 times in the last 3 years. Always comfortable rooms, dark which is condusive to sleeping well! Just make sure that you are not on the end of the building- those rooms overlook the train tracks and are noisy! Pool and jacuzzi are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy, dark, dirty and depressing. Only good thing is the location.”
Reviews.Author: Rallyadam
Reviews.Content: Location next to the convention centre is excellent. First impressions, poor and dingy rooms. Air conditioning is louder than the trains that run through the hotel like an earthquake. Not enough to supress the sounds of the next rooms guest snoring. Air conditioning panel is loose. No in room safe. Shower is dreadful, spits out the head and bath tap at the same time. The tap was loose and stuck to the bottom of the bath is a non slip sheet which has come partially un stuck and when lifted reveals a disgusting collection of hairs and other body debris. Bath and the sink don't want to drain away. Stayed in room 329 avoid at all vosts,the view is of an internal wall no natural light to talk of. Hated the hotel it resembles Disneys tower of terror. Stay somewhere else...

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Chas1979
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. They let me check in at 8:30 am and go ahead and get my room. Hotel has one of the coolest interiors I have seen. Bed was comfy. Shower was AMAZING! Huge shower head, great pressure, and plenty of warm water. Also had a warming light in the bathroom. Nice large pool for a downtown city hotel. Had so much fun it it.

Reviews.Title: “You can't miss with Crowne Plaza!”
Reviews.Author: Tim E
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza's are always good, but his one is an old converted train station and boy does it have old world character. But don't missunderstand, its a gorgeous luxury hotel. Oh, and they are motorcycle friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Fun but Aging”
Reviews.Author: lovethelake
Reviews.Content: When booking this hotel I called them directly to get one of the train car rooms; it was the same price booking directly as it was online. It was fun to "board" and settle into our car, but after the novelty wore off we noticed the signs of aging - peeling wallpaper, scuffed paint, and an actual large hole in the wall behind a nightstand which I noticed when leaning back there to plug in the nightstand clock. The bed was comfortable, and the room very quiet. The included breakfast in the morning was very good, though the staff could use some training - our waitress had to be asked for both cream and sugar for the coffee, both of which she forgot, and later she had to be flagged down for coffee (and cream and sugar) refills, even though there were only 2 other tables occupied. This place is fun for one stay, but there are other hotels in the area with larger, more modern rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fun times.”
Reviews.Author: msawyer2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very unique and fun. We stayed in a train car for just one night - on a Saturday. The only downfall I can think of is that the air-conditioning was somewhat lacking. I like my rooms cold (especially when I'm getting ready, blow drying hair, etc.); and the car only had one vent over by the beds. It was great for sleeping, and other than that short getting-ready time, it was fine. We did hear the trains going by a couple times throughout the night, but it was nothing to squack at (unless you are a VERY VERY light sleeper, you should be find!). It was really expensive in my opinion though - but we were also there (unknowingly) on a huge convention weekend and every place was completely booked!

Reviews.Title: “Right loaction Right price!”
Reviews.Author: jp_edwards
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right down town so I could park and wonder around the night life after the day's meetings. It's right at the edge of everything and near the Slippery Noodle Inn ... a great Blues joint with excellent food and live music. A short walk away is the Circle Center mall and Conseco Field House. I got GREAT prices from priceline ... I just bid on a 3 1/2 star in the downtown area, there is only 3 or 4 hotels that are 3 1/2 stars and I usually get the Crowne ... good for the family too, be cause it used to be a train station and still has trains running by everyday. Pool is small but rarely used. I always like this place

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with unusual features worth booking”
Reviews.Author: Thehearts
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel made special by the fact that it is built around an old train station and there are old pullman carriages which are now guest rooms. We didn't manage to stay in these rooms. We stayed initially on floor three which was much hotter and the air conditioning is noisy but the maids do a good job on the rooms and they are clean and well stocked with tolietries and coffee etc. After a short break away we re checked into a floor on room two which was more comfortable. The photos of the pool make it look huge - in fact it is very small so you may be disappointed. It has a small gym. I think they have given up on the restaurant which is a shame but it is expensive and there isn't much choice. We went across the road to 43 coffee shop which was excellent and good value. Most of the staff were wonderful and very well mannered but there was one guy on the door who was obviously annoyed we didn't tip him when he took us somewhere on our first day (i only had four $50 dollar bills and planned to tip him on my return but he had gone). The next time he took us out it was outside the zone but the manager had said it was ok and he could not have been more rude or passively aggressive. This time I had a tip sorted out but he really didn't deserve it. We caught a taxi back rather than have to sit in a car with him he made us feel so uncomfortable. But all the other guys who took us to baseball or other places were lovely. Overall I would recommend this hotel for busness or leisure it's a great location for downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Don't have high expectations.”
Reviews.Author: NorthshorePA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights on business in a converted train car. I had been looking forward to this aspect of my trip and the room itself did not disappoint. However, housekeeping did not show up one of the days at all, but then knocked on my door every half hour on my final morning even with a do not disturb sign posted. I was also "upgraded" with club lounge access, but it was a complete joke. I realize I might have been spoiled with CPs in other locations (Little Rock and Columbus, OH come to mind), but this lounge was truly lacking in every way. Breakfast one morning consisted of slices of French toast with nothing else. The same went for dinner snacks with fairly pitiful (grease laden) selections. The only other bright spots were Walt (the bartender) and a few of the valet drivers who always had smiles on their faces.

Reviews.Title: “For train fans”
Reviews.Author: tellico1200
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business trip and was placed in room away from active train station. Quiet room and perfectly fine for work and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: puzzlesforlife
Reviews.Content: This hotel is full of character. They carried out the train motif throughout the hotel and even had train cars for rooms. I would love to try that out the next time we stay. There is an actual train that does run under the hotel so it was a little noisy at about 11:30ish at night but that was the only time we were disturbed by the noise and it ran pretty quickly. The room was very clean and the beds were the most comfortable we have ever slept on in a hotel. We really enjoyed our visit and would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Place - Nice Room, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: undum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in the middle of July. The staff was friendly on arrival and throughout our stay. I chose this hotel in part due to frequent guest status and in part due to the unique character of the property. Our Priority Club status was acknowledged and the room was upgraded. This was a nice benefit. The hotel, built out of the old train station, proved to be as interesting as we hoped. The trains do run nearby and they can be heard but after hearing it the first time, it was not a concern. The room was clean and ready upon arrival. The carpet was a bit dirty from stains but the bed was comfortable and the appointments were very nice. The desk/work area was very useful. The cost was reasonable. The hotel is adjacent to the convention center and within walking distance of the two sports stadiums. There are numerous other hotels and restaurants in the area - easily within walking distance - as is the City Center Mall. Parking is pricey at $27 per day (valet) or $22 per day self serve (however self serve does not provide in and out privileges). (This was the only drawback I noted during the stay.) We would certainly stay there again for business and would even consider a trip back with the family as the city was very interesting and there were several museums and entertainment venues that we did not have time to explore on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: mrklean1911
Reviews.Content: Hotel has aged. The rooms are clean but need updating. The staff was great and we never heard any trains :) I would stay here again if I could get discount rate.

Reviews.Title: “Just needed a place to stay, but it was so much more.”
Reviews.Author: bweber8182
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a little weekend getaway for my fiance and I. I used Priceline so I got a good price. We arrived 2 hours before check in time and not only were able to get in our room, but also were upgraded to an executive room. It was huge, clean and very nice looking. We were in town for a music festival at Victory Field which is an easy walk from the hotel as is just about anything in your beautiful city. On the morning of our departure we explored the area and the hotel. The railroad cars look like a lot of fun. Maybe next time we'll stay in one of those. Anyway, I just wanted to say that I had read a lot of the negative reviews on here and I found them to be 100% false. Yes, we did hear 1 train in the middle of the night, but it lasted for about 15 seconds and you do warn people that it is an active train station so I really don't know what else they would expect. Thanks for everything. It was a great experience. Big, clean rooms and it was very quiet except for the 1 train.

Reviews.Title: “Another Satisfactory Stay”
Reviews.Author: huntlawoffice
Reviews.Content: Very similar experience as with my previous (original) review. Got another good rate on Hotwire, so that colors this slightly. (Total cost for two nights, plus tax, was about what the nightly rate was at the "seminar rate" at a nearby hotel.) As before I a couple of nights to save having to drive a few hours each day to a multi-day seminar, but this time the family didn't join me. Staff was pleasant - both on check-in & out - no problem that I checked out a little bit "late" (during the seminar's lunch break, about 30 minutes "late" - I ask about it in advance and told it would be no problem). Room was on the north part of the hotel and had absolutely no train noise issues. Room was perhaps in a little better shape than I remembered from my previous stay. Bed was better (my previous stay it seemed too soft for my tastes). It's worth noting that the hotel now has a skybridge to the Convention Center expansion, so you don't have to go outside to reach the Convention Center (although I did as weather was okay). Beyond that (and I don't remember if I mentioned this last review or not), it's worth noting that the hotel "windows" all over see the interior of the hotel. Thus, there is light coming in from them, even at night. The hotel does provide heavy curtains that do a fine job of blocking the light - but be aware of this and that you don't have any kind of view from the windows. One other point is you can save a few bucks (something like $5/night) if you self-park at the adjacent Pan-American Plaza parking, but be aware that it's a strict hourly rate; the valet rate does give you in/out privileges. That's about all - another happy stay - and won't hesitate to book again. That said, I might not feel as good if I had paid full price for the room. hlo

Reviews.Title: “Ambience if you're adventurous”
Reviews.Author: Nonnypop
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for three nights on business. If you are the adventurous type, you'll enjoy the unique experience this hotel offers. The concept of staying in a renovated train station has its appeal and I like the out-of-the-ordinary, so this definitely qualifies. It was fun exploring the building and viewing the vintage decor and train cars. Walking distance to all kinds of excitement in downtown Indy! Lunch in the hotel lounge was excellent, reasonably priced, and the room service chicken quesadillas I had for dinner were some of the best I ever ate. Staff is very friendly and helpful, a great crew! Fitness room was excellent. The king room I stayed in was adequate, the bed fair but I slept well enough. Wireless internet worked fine there although tv reception was fuzzy on half the channels. The room was on the side of the building away from the tracks, so noise from the trains was minimal. Other reviewers have mentioned the late-night noise in the hallways, and even though there are signs posted throughout reminding patrons of quiet time in the evening, there were still people (including children) yelling and running in the hallways late at night. In reality, people aren't always on their best behavior when staying at hotels, and let's face it, some people are just plain morons to begin with. I solved that problem long ago by traveling with a small fan or white noise machine to mask unwanted noise and I sleep just fine. Overall, this hotel may not be for everyone, but I enjoyed my stay and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: ChattieNattie
Reviews.Content: At $159 per night, I had higher expectations for this hotel. While the staff was courteous, the rooms were drab and dated, and my hotel room window literally looked out onto a train track and trains went by most of the night (think "My Cousin Vinny"). To make matters worse, there was loud rumbling periodically throughout the night which I attributed in the morning to the ice machine that was just on the other side of the wall from the bed. Thank goodness this was only a one-night stay. Unfortunately, that was too long for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, unique hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: ladybiztraveler
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler, I really enjoyed my stay here overall as it is a very unique property. The way they incorporated the old station features into the hotel architecture is very interesting and fun. It is in a super location for the convention center, Lucas Oil Stadium and some wonderful downtown restaurants. I was on the 3rd floor, on the stadium side. I did hear and feel trains at various hours, (which the front desk staff had told me about), but it was not bothersome and kind of cool I thought. I believe they will accomodate you if you ask for a room away from the trains. I booked through an online discounter and got a great rate. The staff was very friendly and helpful with directions, cab help etc. I did eat in the bar/restaurant one evening, and while it was a fairly limited menu, my food was fine. The service there was also very friendly and prompt. I enjoyed walking along the train cars on either side, like a museum! My only complaint was the ethernet cord in my room was on the night stand between the two double beds, so it forced me to do my laptop work on the bed, which wasn't very conducive to me staying awake! :-) It would be nice to have had a work desk with the ethernet there. The bathroom could use a bit of updating, but nice ammenities and everything seemed to work fine. I will definitely stay here again when I work in downtown Indy. A break from the norm and it's fun to explore the property!

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel, good location, never heard a train”
Reviews.Author: Cassyt
Reviews.Content: ...but I felt them, like a small earthquake, or magic fingers on the bed. I booked through Priceline and was also slightly wary of the reviews. Upon arrival, I asked for a room away from the trains and was given the Amelia Earhardt room. (On the Green trains side.) "Don't get lost!" the manager said as he directed me o the room. As a Priority Club member, I was given a free drink coupon for each night I booked good for beer, wine, soda, coffee, etc. The hotel is attached to the convention center, near a mall and so many major chain dining establishments, you could eat out for weeks and never hit the same restaurant twice. Some things to think about when booking a train car room: 1. No handicap access. You need to be able to haul bags up the 4 ft steel stairs into the train car. 2. It's narrow. The bed went from one side of the room almost to the other. 3. Even though my train car faced the outside of the building, there was an area between the car and outside. The light and views were nothing great. If you train car is on the inside, it will overlook the hallway. 4. If you want to feel as though you are sleeping above the train station (because you are) ask for a train car on the Blue side. The Green cars are on the quiet side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and never heard a train!”
Reviews.Author: Tamara6959
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband, and 8 year-old daughter stayed in this hotel for 1 night while in Indy to visit the children's museum. We arrived on Sunday around 2pm and our room was ready. The girl at check-in was very friendly and offered suggestions on what to do that was close-by. Our room(#207) was clean and spacious. After reading several reviews about train noise, I was a bit apprehensive. However, we did not hear any train noise at all. In fact, this hotel was so quiet while we were there, it was almost eerie! If I hadn't passed a few people entering their rooms in the hallway, I would have sworn we were the only ones in the hotel. The pool area was open until 10pm so we went down for a while after dinner. Again, we were the only ones there the entire time. The pool area is nice, but is about due for a remodel. Nothing major, just noticed some rust spots, broken jets, etc. I would have no problems staying at this hotel again. The train car rooms look really neat and the setting is unlike any other hotel you will find. Only drawbacks are parking which will run you $27 a day unless you come on the weekend and can find street parking which is free. We found a spot close to the hotel, but my husband had to get up and move to the garage by 7am Monday. Kind of annoying, but worth the $25 savings!

Reviews.Title: “Can you afford cleaning solutions?”
Reviews.Author: pedaway
Reviews.Content: So disapointing to take a friend and find out the place is dirty and smelly. The nastalgia doesn't make it on its own people . You must clean clean clean. Oh yea $6.50 cents for a very very weak drink doesn't work either! What a rip-off the parking was too! Priceline failed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Anne-R-03
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews about "train noise", I was a little nervous to stay at the Crowne Plaza. Because we were coming to Indy for medical reasons, I called to ask if we could get a quiet room. It so happened that one of the Women's Final Four teams was staying at the hotel at the same time. The general manager went out of his way to make sure we knew there could be more activity than usual. He also made sure we were taken care of (never heard or felt a train). I know we would not have gotten service like that at any other downtown hotel. It speaks volumes that they were willing to go above and beyond to make sure one family had a quiet room with such a huge event going on at the same time. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. And to top it all off, my boys had a great time and loved the pool! It was a really cool hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I would have done it different.”
Reviews.Author: colerob85
Reviews.Content: This place is terrible. We checked in and I automatically thought "what have I gotten myself into?" It is scary old--"historic, if you will"--good thing the valet parking is a deal at $27 DOLLARS a day!!! A train went through and scared the living hell out of my wife and I. I didn't sleep for two days, nor did she. Good thing the front desk warned us about this before hand--oh wait, no they didn't. The concierge acted surprised when I told him about the train rattling my room and stated that the front desk should have warned me about the trains. I will never, ever, ever stay here again and I hope God has mercy on the souls of all who decide to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “If you stay here, pack sleeping pills, liquor & earplugs”
Reviews.Author: thisismyfakename
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice to look at...very nice & historical. I'll say that first. I got my room for $50/night through Priceline. So that was great. I'd definitely suggest that you do the valet parking (currently $27/day plus $2-3 tip every time they pick up your car). Parking nearby is about $22/day. The room service was nice and actually affordable (about $9 for a breakfast of bacon, eggs, toast & potatoes)...the price includes the 20% gratuity and tax. The rooms were nice. They were clean. Beds were comfy. BUT..... HERE'S WHERE IT GETS INTERESTING.... When I checked in, there was a little kit on my bed with earplugs & a sleep mask. Right as I was about to fall asleep that night, I realized why they gave me earplugs. The room started shaking and there was a rumbling like an earthquake! Then a train roared by just a few feet from my room. When I checked in, no one informed me that my room was almost sitting on the railroad tracks. Nor did they tell how loud and scary the trains sound or how often they roll by. Now, when I read the reviews, I see that I'm not alone. I had to take sleeping pills and use the earplugs, and even then, I could only get a couple hours of sleep. To add "insult to injury", there was a huge amount of partying going on until 5:00 AM. I had to call security twice to get some loud drunken people out of the hallway. The first time I called, I don't think they even checked on the noise. I stayed two nights. Both nights were awful. It's too noisy from trains & from drunks. I would definitely not stay there again. Next time I'll pay a little more and stay at the Omni right next door. The Omni is a dream. This hotel was a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “10th anniversary nightmare”
Reviews.Author: lindajoy61357
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? I had booked the "Romancing the Station" package online for our 10th wedding anniversary. When we checked in, I had to ask about the package and the clerk said he would take care of booking the carriage for us. For some reason we had an "upgraded" room. Maybe because there was a big wedding and ROTC ball of some sort. Anyway, we weren't impressed with the suite. A king room would have been more cozy for one night. We went to the restaurant that is in the hotel and it was horrible. They weren't even serving in the dining room. We had to eat in the bar and the menu was so very limited as you would expect in a bar. Our food tasted like it was out of a frozen bag. There was no one else in the bar besides myself and husband and the waitress never checked on us once. She finally asked us if we wanted more tea when we were finished with our meal. So, when it was time for our "15 minute" carriage ride that was included in the package, we saw the desk clerk and she told us to go out front and it would be waiting for us. We waited over 15 minutes in the cold and still no carriage. The valet manager (very nice man) called the carriage company and they said no one from the hotel called them. They did end up sending a carriage and we did go for a ride and the driver was very nice and answered our questions. We loved the horse (Blue) who allowed us to pet him and was very gentle. Moving along, while we relaxed in our room, a train came through and it was somewhat muffled and we were fine with this. However, while we tried to sleep through the night, it was so loud and sounded and felt like trains were going through our room. We got no sleep! In the morning, whe found that the bathroom fan wasn't working and so while my husband was trying to get ready in the bathroom, the mirror was fogged up from me taking a shower. In the morning, my husband asked for the free newspaper that was supposed to be included in our package. The desk clerk told him that it is only Monday thru Friday and not on the weekends. Didn't mention anything about "only on the weekdays" online. I will say that the breakfast buffet that also is included in the package was good. Thank goodness it wasn't served in the bar. When we checked out that morning, the clerk didn't ask us about our stay. He didn't seem a bit concerned. My husband and I would not recommend this hotel. There are many other hotels to choose from in downtown Indianapolis. P.S. I even e-mailed the hotel with feed-back (I included my confirmation #) and I got no response from anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Always Stay Here on Business in Indy”
Reviews.Author: TravelfortheSoul
Reviews.Content: Love the fact that this Crowne Plaza is a restored/active train station. In some of the rooms you can hear the trains, so ask for a room away from the tracks. Also, some rooms are converted train cars - I've never stayed in a train car, would like too. The hotel is centrally located downtown, walking distant to restaurants and shopping. The only reason for the lower rating is the noise from active trains in some rooms. I always ask for quite room.

Reviews.Title: “Box Car for Business”
Reviews.Author: Halodiva
Reviews.Content: When you are in Indianapolis, you have to stay at this hotel and you have to stay in one of their train cars. A little on the pricey side, but if you are in one of their train cars, you won't mind. I've been to this hotel several times, but never got to stay in one of the train cars before. What a treat. I really felt as if I was in a train car. The hotel is clean and beautiful. Receiving a free drink card with my check in was an added bonus (for those that are over the age of 21 of course). The hotel bar was cozy and the bartender was very pleasant. Since I come here on business I'm familiar with Indianapolis, but he was great at recommending Indy's hot spots to guests that had never been to the city. Overall, my trip from home, to Tampa, to Indianapolis, back to Tampa, and back home was one of the best I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Historical and unique experience”
Reviews.Author: peacepax
Reviews.Content: I like staying in unique and historical hotels and Crowne Plaza Union Station fits the bill. I thought it was cool to see the train and sculptures around the hotel. It IS a working station so yes the train is loud when it passes by. I've stayed here other times, some rooms are quieter than others so ask when you check in. I am a deep sleeper so it's not really an issue. Since it is a historic hotel, rooms are dated but comfortable and clean. Fitness area was okay but not as nice as some of the other downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Service as it should be!”
Reviews.Author: rav4momOhio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem in Indy. I stayed there with my hubbie and daughter. The train car room was AWESOME! My daughter loved it. Hotel was very forthcoming about train noise - offered us a train car on the quiet side. We had no issues.! Had dinner in restaurant and room service for breakfast - both were delicious! Enjoyed the indoor pool although a little cold - I don't think heater was working. Had to take my daughter out when her teeth were chattering. Hot tub was fabulous though! Hotel was clean and I inspect in this age if bed bugs. Glad to say nothing to report! Great Vacation. Make sure to take kids to Children's Museum! Only a few minutes away!

Reviews.Title: “Cool place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: pedsrrt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a train car and my kids loved it. It was really cool to walk up to our own train and climb the stairs and open the door. We went on a weekend and it was not crowded. We had the entire pool to ourselves. The hot tub needed to be cleaned and could not figure out how to turn on the jets. Other then that everything was great. I would recommend staying here. We did hear and feel the trains at night, but it was not really a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: j o
Reviews.Content: We stay here every year for the Dealer Expo. The rooms are so nice, clean, comfortable, quite and the bedding is delightful. I cannot say one negative thing about this place other than I wish I visited it in the summer time instead of in the dead of Indiana Winter!

Reviews.Title: “Spider Nightmares”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysAMomFirst
Reviews.Content: Room was dirty and cob webs were hanging in corners and in canned lights. Live 'large" spider crawling on bed one night. Trains were only loud in bathroom but could be issue if you are a light sleeper. Not a great overall room experience. Meeting areas were adequate, noise from live train traffic. Very Basic. Staff was helpful and great location for seeing downtown area. Train car rooms did look interesting and might be cleaner?

Reviews.Title: “Dark, dank and depressing.”
Reviews.Author: peanutthebunny
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in September. My frist impression...what a weird hotel. It looks more like a warehouse. We arrived and were given a room with a view of the inside of the hotel...more specifically a train. We had no outside window and the room was dark and depressing. As I was unpacking (barefoot) I sat down and felt something soft and frilly with my toe...I looked down...it was a pair of dirty underpants. Gross. At night we were awakened by drunken teenagers running through the halls. The walls were paper thin. The bathroom was dank and depressing like the rest of the hotel. We could have stayed at the Omni or a number of other nice hotels for almost the same price. Don't stay here....find soemthing better for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ryno611
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love the Crowne Plaza at Union Station. It has a lot of character and is very relaxing. The pool and hot tub are also very relaxing. We highly recommend this hotel. The service is remarkable!

Reviews.Title: “Unique Property - Nice Change of Pace”
Reviews.Author: medicalalert
Reviews.Content: As you've probably read in other reviews, this hotel is in a converted train station. Yes, the trains tend to rattle adn shake a little, but it's not too distracting. The environment itself is enough to make it worth trying - especially if you trvel frequently. I'm tired fo waking-up wondering what city or hotel I'm in - that's not a problem here. Rooms are clean and a little tired - bathrooms could use some sprucing, tv's could be updated. The work space in guestrooms is productive, although you have only one power outlet. The pool and exercise area seem fine. The restaurant is a disappointment - after a so-so breakfast Day 1, I left and went to a nearby restaurant for something cheaper and better on Day 2. Smoker's surround the fornt doors - not a pleasant trip in/out of the hotel (and I made that trip about 10 times). Location is great - right next to the soon-to-pen convention center, a stone's throw from Lucas Field (Colts Stadium), and plenty of restaurants within three blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Bad News!”
Reviews.Author: hitchellb
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for business. Me and a coworker sharing a room to be closer to the action downtown (as oppose to 2 rooms by the airport). Boy I wish I hadn't. We got stuck with one bed. No space for a cot. No apology from the manager or staff. They actually found it kind of funny when we asked for a room with 2 double beds, which is what I thought I had booked. They said they were full up but we came right at check in and we asked at the counter. When asked if they could see what they could do, they said they would call us back regardless, they never did. No one ever apologized to us either, for the inconvenience, like I said before they seem to find it funny. Having to stay in a bed with a co-worker on business is not funny. Unless you are with a convention, they don't really seem to care about you. Last small thing: They never had water in the vending machines (any of the vending machines, my entire stay I told them about it twice). I suspect that's because they sell it in the gift shop for 50 cent more. Not a big deal, but just seemed par for the course.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with friendly service but the train whistle was loud!”
Reviews.Author: clschanher
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely, bathroom was very small but a great shower head and heat lamp. A very friendly staff with the exception of the manager when we checked in who was quite arrogant. The restaurant meat was excellent. It's located close to the convention center and many restaurants so you can park the car and walk. The major problem was sleeping, even though the beds were very comfortable, the train noise and whistle was very loud. They provided ear plugs but I couldn't wear them and even when I tried I could still hear the train. Perhaps it was my room location and not all the rooms are as noisy. That's the biggest criticism and they did everything possible to help with the noise. If you're a light sleeper like me this may not be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Freight train noise and paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: lajd2003
Reviews.Content: No one at the hotel explained to us that Union Station is still an active train station - you cannot tell by the exterior at all! At midnight we were awakened to the sound of a freight train running past our room. The walls shook and it sounded like an earthquake. It happened about five times during the night and scared us to death! The walls are paper thin also. The room next to us had their TV on at 3 a.m. and we could hear it as if they were in the room with us. Not a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you aren't bothered by the noise”
Reviews.Author: robs4219
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August 2010 for the MotoGP weekend. Being housed in an old train station, the hotel is definitely interesting with a unique charm. The only downside is that there are active train tracks right next door, so it can be noisy. I was woken up a few times by the trains. I only found it mildly annoying, but I think a lighter sleeper would have some serious issues. The rooms are adequate, nothing special but nothing particularly bad about them. They look like any other Crowne Plaza anywhere in the world. They're definitely starting to look a little worn though. The beds themselves are comfortable, everything is clean, and the room was spacious. The staff (front desk & valets) were very helpful and friendly. Wifi is free, but very slow. There are a couple of computers for guests to use in the lobby, which is very convenient. The location is excellent, just a 2-3 minute walk to the shops, restaurants, and bars around Meridian Street. As others have mentioned, valet parking is $27/day with in/out privileges. All in all, it was a pleasant stay and I would likely stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: babsi3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, quite clean and quaint. Close to the city center, to the convention center and to all the facilities. It was not very plesant when the train noise made me wake up at 6am... I also didn't like that the windows never overlook outside.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but kinda noisy on ground floor.”
Reviews.Author: inxsary
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, and a friend stayed at the Crowne Plaza for GenCon (Aug 4-8). We used some hotel reward points and were told we could only have a room on the ground floor if we used points. Having been to this hotel before, we knew this could be a bad move with the convention in town....the hotel hosted some of the con events, so they would be very busy traffic-wise. At night the hotel is quiet, but during the day, not so much....our room was next to a service hallway (our other room door opened into it) which clattered with restaurant noise starting at 6am. We could hear and feel almost every door slam. And we were also close to the pool, whose noise echoed in the lobby area. Otherwise, the room itself was ample, clean, and the beds were comfy. The wireless internet (free) was very slow....but might think that is because of the type of crowd there at the time- lots of gamers sucking up the bandwith playing WoW.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place in a unique setting”
Reviews.Author: kevk91
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a last-minute weekend leisure stay here. The property is like many Crowne Plazas... nice but getting a little worn around the edges. But the unique facility inside a restored train station makes the place memorable. The hotel front desk and rooms are in a part of the train shed which makes a unique setting for an otherwise standard-issue Crowne Plaza. The recognizable bell-tower is actually across the street and that part of the facility is used for large receptions and events. Plaster-cast statues of train station visitors from yesteryear line the property and add some "charm" to the place. Most of the rooms (like mine) face hallways in the train shed while room windows face out into the atrium. Interesting is that old Pullman sleeper cars have been creatively restored into hotel suites across from the standard rooms on both sides of the hotel. While some have written about noise from trains interrupting sleep, I had a room on the opposite (north) side of the building and never heard a thing. You may want to request a room there. The exercise facility is tucked in a back-corner of the train shed near the convention center exit. It's awesome with brand new state-of-the art equipment (personal flat-screen tvs and fans on each machine) and a nice view of the downtown skyline. A few new furnishings (like flat-panel tvs in the rooms) would help modernize the facility. As long as you are not expecting new construction luxury, the rooms should fit your needs. I'm also not a fan of valet parking, and here it's mandatory for $27 a day. A valet attendant informed me that you can self-park at a garage nearby for slightly less, but it doesn't come with in-out priveleges. Overall, the valets were speedy and friendly. The attendants, however, were MIA when I returned from a late-night excursion even though they are supposed to be a 24-hour operation. Even the desk clerk couldn't find them and ultimately had to take my car key herself. The location is hard to beat. It's next door to Lucas Oil Stadium and an easy walk to any of the stores, restaurants and sites downtown. Downtown Indy is very pedestrian friendly, and the Crowne's location is also very accessible to the interstates without getting caught in a lot of congestion. The staff was nice, and the facility was too.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: indygirl72
Reviews.Content: I was not happy with this hotel at all. The front desk staff were very rude beyond belief. Not only when I made my reservation and they HUNG UP on me and then I had to call back but also when I arrived. Both check in and check out were unpleasant... not only from the front desk staff but from the General Manager also. I can understand being busy and not being entirely overly pleasant but they more went out of their way to be unfriendly! The rooms were not very clean and the noise level in the hotel was awful. We were woken up by kids screaming in the pool by 8 am and the cleaning staff blaring their music on the cleaning carts. I have many events taking place in Indianapolis where I need overnight accomodations but will NEVER stay at this Crowne Plaza again. The hotel location is great... and the staff knows they will get business because of that. However there is no reason for any staff to be as rude as this locations staff were and I will never stay this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Kyra9059
Reviews.Content: My husband was in Indianapolis on business and I tagged along. He has been there many times but this was my first trip. I loved the hotel and the location. There were so much within walking distance. It was so easy to entertain myself when he was working. The staff at the hotel was great. They were extremely helpful and friendly. That is one of the things that struck me the most about the city...everyone was so nice and so friendly. I have been telling all of my friends that they need to visit Indy and stay at the Crowne Plaza Union Station. I hope he invites me the next time he travels to Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, outstanding location, awesome service!”
Reviews.Author: bsu1999
Reviews.Content: Service was outstanding from the moment we pulled up. We were quickly greeted by the valet staff whom helped us get our bikes out of the back of our SUV as well as grab our bags. They checked our bikes into storage before we even got checked-in, which was nice b/c we didn't have to keep them in our 3rd floor room. Check-in was painless and we were given a free drink coupon and a 15% off coupon for the hotel's restaurant, which was pretty tasty. We were able to check in hours ahead of schedule and given a 2 p.m. checkout. Other pros: +Closest hotel to Lucas Oil Stadium, which has $7/adult tours on Tues. & Wed. +Walking distance to everything, but for those who need rides, the shuttle (if available) will transport you around town. They dropped us off at the Indians game and left us with a card to call for pickup. +Decent indoor pool +Computers/printer for public use and free wi-fi in the room Cons: - Jacuzzi was down during our stay. Apparently they were waiting for parts ??? -Lack of HDTV in rooms. They have the old box tvs of yesteryear. -If you are an extremely light sleeper the vibrations/noise from the trains passing may bother you. It didn't me though. -$25/night Parking for valet which will soon be $27. Self park with no in/out doesn't save much $ though so valet is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Not off to a good start”
Reviews.Author: Vabel
Reviews.Content: I am staying at this hotel on Wednesday night, and when I called to inquire about the transportation to and from the airport. A woman named Kesha answered the phone and became rather belligerent explaining the options. I haven't been to Indianapolis before and I found her attitude far less than helpful. After reading the other reviews, I was excited about staying at this hotel, however now I fear it is going to be a dreadful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: huntlawoffice
Reviews.Content: Trip was actually a combination business & leisure. I was in town for a two-day seminar and "Hotwired" a downtown hotel to avoid an hour plus drive (one-way) each day. Then added a couple of nights for a mini-vacation (joined by my family on Friday afternoon). Very happy with our stay, at least partly because of the good rate from Hotwire. The hotel was about what was expected very nice but it's not "top-of-the-line" fancy. Being in the old Union Station area was nice and, while we didn't get one of the Pullman suites, just seeing the cars was neat. Briefly: Pros: Location - *very* close to convention center & Lucas Oil stadium, close to all the downtown restaurants, night-life, entertainment, etc. Friendly & efficient staff; All the basics taken care of: clean, comfortable enough, everything worked (although in truth the bed was too soft for my taste, but that's personal choice); Didn't nickel & dime as many hotels in this price range do, "business center" allowed free internet access & printing; valet parking, while not cheap (and we didn't use it) was only a few dollars more than self-parking and included in-out privileges; Nice lobby, reasonable pool, etc. Cons: Some noise from the nearby train tracks, but nothing that bothered us (we were close, but not the closest rooms); A nearby room was noisy before we left for dinner (and we were afraid it might be an issue), but it was quiet when we got back; Location - while easily within walking distance of all the downtown stuff, it is not the most centrally located of the downtown hotels (but, still an easy walk to everything); Night "light" as most (all?) of the rooms overlook the lobby rather then being exterior windows, there is some ambient light (I remember noting it was later than I thought it was and then realized it was because it was still light "outside") - that said, they have some *very* good blackout style drapes that completely took care of this issue. Regarding an earlier review & "party rooms." As I mentioned we had some noise, but it wasn't a problem. I did notice the hotel has an official "quiet hours" policy (I believe starting at 10:00 pm) and, while we didn't have to, I was prepared to complain to the front desk and just put the problem in their lap. Overall, very happy with our stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again (especially at the Hotwire rate).

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Crown Plaza”
Reviews.Author: TARBINDIANA
Reviews.Content: Our family visited this great historic hotel this week for two nights and I have to report that customer service is top notch at this hotel!!! My grandson's stay was made very special by our upgrade to a " train room". We found that Crowne Plaza has a very caring staff that goes out of their way to make your stay very enjoyable. We witnessed this with the clerk when we checked in, the valet service, and the gentlemen that was dressed like a conductor in the lobby who made our grandson's day! What a great place for a getaway. The "train rooms" were an unexpected delight, and as usual , downtown Indianapolis is a great place to visit with their great dining options...

Reviews.Title: “Noisy convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: EasyRiderTour
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are fine, but it seems the Crowne Plaza has become the preferred choice for any kind of mass gathering. Our one-night stay on a Saturday night was marred by hundreds of girl scouts, several weddings, late night noise in the halls, in the pool area, in the elevators, lots of exciting activity in the rooms on either side (and thin walls). We are weary road dogs, and we have learned not to expect much sleep at any Crowne Plaza. Amenities are nice, but the primary function of any hotel is SLEEP. At the Crowne Plaza, however, the motto should be "...where the party never ends!"

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza (Union Station-Indy)”
Reviews.Author: smashthings
Reviews.Content: Very cool hotel to stay in, the train car rooms are quite awesome!!! Perfect for something different to surprise the significant other.... also great for the kiddies who get to see a train inside their hotel!!! LoL Highly recommend booking the train car rooms over the standard room though as they can be a bit bland but still a nice stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, I rather stay some where else next time”
Reviews.Author: Dansladen
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at this hotel while attending a conference at the hotel. Check was quick and easy and I was upgraded to a "club suite".
