The front desk staff warned me about the train noise which did not bother me at all. They did not warn me about my room being next to the hotel bar lounge which did bother me a lot. I guess the hotel staff knows that this hotel has "noise issues" since they go out of their way to put ear plugs and eye masks in the room (something I have never see before in all my travels). The food during our event was average and did not impress me at all. While the staff was friendly and helpful, I will try another hotel in the area next time I go to Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Dated interior Exterior needs helps”
Reviews.Author: MrFunkinDC
Reviews.Content: The rooms are interior rooms and the windows do not look out to the street but get there light from sky lights. Rooms were a good size, there was not a working desk but a table. Internet cable (free) was on the opposite side of the room from the desk which makes it difficult to work. The parking garage attached is pretty scary including that noise on the elevator which made me think I was going to get stuck. Swimming pools was shaped more for children than doing laps. Fitness room was very small I have no issues with the hotel but it was nothing special. I booked the hotel through Hotwire which rated it as a 31/2 star was $59 a night. This would be a fun hotel for a family who would want to stay in one of the train cars.

Reviews.Title: “Lookout”
Reviews.Author: beautyMichigan
Reviews.Content: Love the customer service here, but the place needs some renovations bad, beds were okay, but we took home some bed bugs, yes I said bed bugs... don't stay here. Previously we had stayed here and loved it but it has consistenly gone down hill. Please fix it up it's worth it, prime location for visitors..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4ThatLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: My son (16) and I stayed here when we went to the Taylor Swift concert. Awesome location!!!! You can walk everywhere you need to be. We only stayed for one night, but it is a great hotel to stay at longer. Room was so comfy..I am hooked on Crowne Plaza! Yes, occassionally you could feel the trains go by, and that made it more awesome! For the people complaining about the train noise and vibrations, quit your whining and relax!!!!! We tried getting the shuttle to take us to the concert because it was pouring, but he couldn't becuase he was helping out some other guests at the hotel. So that was s bummer. And it doens't have an airport shuttle, which is another bummer. But I would still definately stay there again if we come into town for a concert. I wanted to stay in the train car, but my son didn't want to....I think he felt too old to. There are statues all over. Really cool. We didn't eat room service. We walked over to the mall after we checked in. Front desk arranged for a cab to get us for our early 6am flight. Quick checkin and out.

Reviews.Title: “My little Engineers loved it”
Reviews.Author: Cocobam
Reviews.Content: We visited on the weekend and stayed in a Pullman car room. My little boys thought it was great! Everything at the hotel was train-themed...even the decorations on the Christmas tree! There were twenty-some Pullman car rooms; two rooms for each train car, with a door at each end. We were in one of the Louis Armstrong rooms, which had two double beds. We are a family of five, but they aren't able to put a trundle bed in the Pullman car rooms because they are so narrow. So we brought along our twin-sized air mattress, and there was barely enough room on the floor for it after we pushed the chairs aside. We could hear a train rumble by from time to time at night, but it was significantly less bothersome than my husband's snoring. We took advantage of the indoor pool when it first opened on Sunday morning, and there were quite a few other people there waiting to swim too. Pool hours are 9AM - 10PM, so if you plan to be sleeping during those hours, you may want to avoid the pool-view rooms. The pool may not be so busy on weekdays though, assuming there are more business travelers during the week. The hotel was in a nice location downtown, which was quite lively Saturday evening. We walked two blocks to eat dinner at the Old Spaghetti Factory, and it was dark when we walked back to the hotel. The area was well-lit and full of people, so we were not concerned walking there with the kids at night. This is not a luxury hotel, and much of it looked like it could use some fixing up. There was a surprising amount of silt at the bottom of the hot tub (when it first opened in the morning)...like you would expect at a beach-front resort where people track sand in. One of the chairs in our room had a large cigarette burn in the arm, and everything could have used a fresh coat of paint. But we are not typically luxury hotel people, and we didn't pay a luxuyr rate, so we felt everything was good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more for the money”
Reviews.Author: EastTNtravelingirl
Reviews.Content: We were excited that the hotel had a historical background. We chose this hotel for its name and expectations that it would have high end quality furnishings. We were disappointed when we arrived in our room. We could have stayed cheaper elsewhere for same furnishings. We stayed in the club area. Only one sink in bathroom with small counterspace. Bed furnishings ok but not plush or high end. Old TV with dark picture. Wasn't staying long enough to wait for front desk to fix problems. Items missing from room that was listed as provided for free with room. Too much money for the quality. Will stay at other hotel if we visit Indianapolis again. City was lovely! Would like to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown hotel with curtious staff”
Reviews.Author: dale3333
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel however it has everything you need. Valet, curtious staff, rest/bar and the location downtown makes it easy for a traveler to walk to just about any place they need. Stayed for a Colts game and the lcoation of the hotel makes for a very easy walk to the stadium.The rooms are large and clean however some items show there date like the TV's - no flat panel; however the area in the Executive lounge has a nice flat panel. All in all a good/safe hotel to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “So cool and historic”
Reviews.Author: firecracker47
Reviews.Content: We came to Indy for a wedding ( not at the Crowne Plaza). We wanted to stay where there were things to do. And we were not disappointed. We chose to book a train car and it was wonderful. We had the Rudolph Valentino Car. The bed was great, the bathroom small, but bigger than Amtrak. It was just cozy and perfect. Though I would hope that flat screen TVs are coming. Since we love trains, we had hoped to see and hear some trains, so I was a little disappointed in that. We did feel a vibration once in awhile. But not seeing the trains in no way detracted from our trip. We found the whole facility clean and in good repair. The staff was friendly, too. The Pullman Car was good. We only ate breakfast there, but the prices were fair. We enjoyed the proximity to St. Elmo's and the other downtown restaurants. And wandering through the old station was so interesting. I thought that the renovation of the property was amazing. It was a fun weekend, indeed owed in a large part to having the Crowne Plaza, Union Station as our home base.

Reviews.Title: “Unique facility, great location, front desk could use improvement”
Reviews.Author: thriftychic
Reviews.Content: I love Crowne Plazas. They usually are above and beyond. That is why I chose a Crowne Plaza in Indianapolis to celebrate my anniversary. We booked a room in the club level. The room was ample sized and well decorated. Our only concern was that the restroom area was extremely small. The club level provides a few extras such as appetizers and drinks in the evening and a continental breakfast on the weekend. These were presented well with friendly staff. There are unique rooms available at this facility actually on a train car. Because we requested a King sized bed, we weren't able to stay in one of these creatively designed rooms. The front desk was able to replace my missing toothbrush with no trouble. However, I did request a couple of additional items to which I knew the desk staff had access and was told that these items weren't available. I determined that perhaps the staff was just busy at the time.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: beachcrazy100
Reviews.Content: As a birthday treat, we stayed in the Valentino Pullman car, which was a pleasant change of pace from a regualr hotel room. I had read that since it was on an active train track, it could be noisy and bothersome, but we did not find that to be the case at all. the room was very clean and nicely decorated. The hotel staff was courteous and pleasant although I expectd the level of customer service to be a bit higher for A Crown Plaza hotel. My disappointment came when I called the day before our arrrival and asked if the hotel did anything to celebrate a birhtdays such as a balloon, piece of cake.... The cleerk that I spoke with said she had no idea and that maybe I should order something from the restaurant to be delivered when I got there. We did arrive early for our check in and the staff was very nice, checked to see exactly when our room would be ready and provided us with options while we waited. We opted to leave our bags with the Valet and go for a walk. We expected the Valet to offer to take the bags to the room when it was ready but we had to ask for that to be done. We only stayed one night but it was a nice stay and the location is great for most anything that you would want to do downtown. Most everythign is within walking distance!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: hawk67
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this property - both times were to attend Colt football games. Check-in went smoothly both times - when we arrived this visit our room was not ready yet - however we were several hours early - they readied the room quickly and delivered our luggage as soon as the room was available. The stadium is across the street - very easy access and with restaurants, shopping and entertainment all within walking distance , we left our car parked for our entire stay. We stayed in the executive club rooms which are accessable only with a key card - there is a private lounge with computers - big screen TV, and a continental breakfast each morning and snacks each evening from 5 - 8 pm. In addtion we received free drink coupons for the lounge. I have read reviews that the trains are bothersome - while I noticed a slight movement when a train passed by, it definelty was not excessive. The property was well kept and the staff was friendly and helpful for our entire stay. My only complaint is that the breakfast buffet is costly ( 14.95 ) and had limited selections. Ala carte items are also available at a much more reasonable rate. The parking garage is right there with valet parking available - since the price of parking is the same whether you self park or use the valet - we used the valet. If you self park you must pay each time you take your car out. Valet includes limitless in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: andreilla12
Reviews.Content: Horrible trip, beginning to end. This is suppoed to be a three star plus hotel, but I'd take a Holiday Inn Express over it any day. The front desk clerk charged us DOUBLE for our stay, we booked a king room and got two double beds (which they wouldn't change), and the restaurant leaves a lot to be desired. If you're going to stay upscale in Indy, skip the Plaza at Union Station.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and historic!”
Reviews.Author: dawnaug
Reviews.Content: This hotel without a doubt is one of the most spectacular places I have ever stayed. Not because of the food, the staff, or the rooms. But because of the historical aspect that it brings. It is the original train station that was built in the early 1900's. And when Holiday Inn purchased and restored it in the 70's they kept almost all of the original structure. It is absolutely beautiful! My husband and I ventured out of our room one evening, we stumbled upon the actual Pulman train inside the building. We then realized that this was more than just a train to look at...they had converted the cars into hotel room you could stay in. At was awesome! As we explored more of the hotel, we found ourselves where the ballrooms were located. We made our way through corridors and found the original Union Station lobby. Very spooky at night, i must say. The bar area resembled something out of The Shining, although very beautiful. The lobby itself was vast with balconies now remodeled into offices. A security guard checked on us and was able to turn on lights for us so we could see this beautiful place in it's glory. In the hallway part of the lobby still stood old ticket booths. I could just picture ladies in their large hats and gentlemen in their suits or immigrants arriving. It was really a magical place. As we walked through the hallways near the grand hall the hotel had numbered standing boards with pictures and writings telliing the history of this building from the time it was built to when it was closed as a train station all the way to when it was purchased and renovated as a hotel. It was quite a treat to realize where I was and the history that had passed through this place. Our room was neat, clean and spacious. My husband is a gold member with Holiday Inn so upon arrival they upgraded us to the club level. Staying at this level you have the privlege of receiving continental breakfast in the morning and appetizers in the early afternoon. A nice suprise to us. The hot tub and pool were clean and well maintained. The only thing about the hotel that people may find annoying is that another part of it still serves as a train station. So you will hear and feel the rumbling of the trains passing by. To us it just made our trip that much more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ole7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with 1 goal in mind. Our kids love trains and wanted to experience the pullman cars. The staff and front desk were very friendly and helpful. The layout of the hotel is odd but you have to understand the historic significance of the building itself. I'm a very light sleep and the rumble of the trains woke me up twice in the night. My husband and children slept right through it. It wasn't loud just the bed shaking lightly. We didn't eat in the restaurant. There was a convention in town so the hotel was very crowded. I would probably call ahead next time to make sure there were no conventions in town before I book a stay. We walked to the Old Spaghetti Factory to eat dinner which was a 2 block walk and a very enjoyable meal. The pullman car rooms are long and narrow which is to be expected. The double beds are very small so be prepared. There is a small refridgerator located in the room. If you have a larger family, you can get adjoining cars. The pool looked small but clean. The children's museum is a short drive away. I was concerned that the pullman cars would be musty but I had no issues. Overall, we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “terrible design for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: whomever
Reviews.Content: i stayed here because it's a convenient location to downtown sites and the hotwire rate was $65. otherwise i would never pay higher rates for this hotel. it's design is poor- why build a luxury hotel next to train tracks? my room rattled and rumbled every time a train went by. it wasn't real loud because i requested a room facing the inner lobby- but that meant there was no outside view and the room felt clausteraphobic and was dark.also, there was a strong chlorine bleach smell from the pool throughout the lobby and in my room. tv reception was very poor with limited channels. otherwise the room was ok. front desk was understaffed, with one person having to answer the phone, man the adjacent gift shop and check people in. so they didn't have time to be friendly or advise me how to get to get to my room. the design is poor and it's difficult to find your room.

Reviews.Title: “Ear plugs are a bad sign”
Reviews.Author: 2UDFlyers
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and my parents stayed at this hotel for one night before a visit to the King Tut exhibit at the Children's Museum. My husband and I booked a regular room for $119, while my parents selected a train car for $130 (these prices did not include the $25 parking fee). My husband and I did not have a pleasant stay. To set the stage, the desk staff warn of the "active trains" that we might hear during the day and night. Then, once in our room, we were greeted with a gift from the hotel of a sleeping mask, linen spray and ear plugs. This was not a good sign. 1. The NOISE. Our room was on the same floor of the pullman train cars - and across the way from the ice machine. In hindsight, upon seeing the ice machine, we should have requested a new room. But we were only staying for 1 night and - how bad could it be, really? It was awful. The ice machine was either being used or in a cycling phase throughout the night - and was extraordinarily loud. Additionally, the walls are paper thin. You could hear everyone coming and going, and our neighbor's television was blasting at some point in the middle of the night. Not to mention, the housekeeping staff was chatting very loudly while cleaning other rooms. To be honest, the rumble of the trains was soothing compared to all the other noises happening around our room. 2. The ROOM: The room itself was standard. The king bed was a little hard. The TV stand was broken, but the TV itself worked just fine. The bathroom was dingy - with dirty wallpaper and the light fixture above the sink was falling down. 3. The BREAKFAST: We met my parents for breakfast at the Pullman Restaurant in the hotel. After sitting for several minutes, we had to ask for service. Then once our server arrived, we weren't sure if she would get our order correct - so we just asked for the simplest item on the menu. The food itself was OK. 4. The HOTEL STAFF: When asked how our stay was when checking out, we pointed out that it was unpleasant due to the noisy room. The man just looked at us and said "I'm sorry to hear that. Please sign your receipt". The most unfortunate impact of our stay at the Crown Plaza was that we were exhausted at the King Tut exhibit. If we come back to Indianapolis, we will book one of the other hotels - such as Omni or Hilton - which are also in the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - A must visit”
Reviews.Author: WHITY10
Reviews.Content: The train car rooms were fabulous which makes for a truly memorable experience. I had my reservations at first, but this definately beat staying in a traditional hotel room. The rooms were very clean, roomy and had a charm to them. The hotel's location is great; easy to walk to any downtown Indy attraction. I would also recommend the Plaza Hotel restaurant as the food was first class. Overall, a fun experience and I would definately bring the kids back to stay in the train car hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Weird hotel”
Reviews.Author: BtownBell
Reviews.Content: This is a strange hotel, with one set of elevators in the middle and a long walk to rooms on either end. Most rooms do not have windows to the outside, but rather windows to the inner atrium. Those with rooms to the outside are on either end of the narrow hotel. On our end, the window overlooked the tear-down site of the Hoosier Dome, in other words a big construction/destruction site. The room was dark due to the one smallish window in the corner and lack of good indoor lighting. Not much if any art on the walls. The long walk to our room on the 3rd floor (#368) took us past the railroad cars that are also used as hotel rooms, which was rather weird to see indoors. Also, everywhere throughout the hotel were all-white statues of railroad travelers from the old days, which looked like ghosts. The pool was OK, but not stocked with towels first thing in the morning, and the hot tub was not comfortable due to the low bench seating. The Pullman restaurant, where we tried to get a late-night snack, had very slow service.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the net?”
Reviews.Author: UF_traveler1
Reviews.Content: This place was a joke! I cant believe anyone would pay the actual nightly rate for this hotel. Its way out of date and living on the fumes of being a formerly "classy" hotel. The room was dingy, dirty and stuck in the past. Dont even get me started with the Internet! Internet didnt work and the "engineer" who came to fix it..wont even go there! I stayed here because I did hotwire, but there are really fantastic hotels just around the corner. Avoid if possible!

Reviews.Title: “A fine, fun hotel in downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Pro55
Reviews.Content: Ever since my wife and I moved to Indianapolis in 2004, we've wanted to stay in a train car at the Crowne Plaza hotel. "What," you say? The Crowne Plaza occupies the city's old train station (I love seeing old buildings repurposed and preserved) and as part of that, they have a number of guest rooms available in train cars. These are nothing like the sleeping accommodations in the Pullman cars of old. They're very comfortable and quite charming, and each room occupies fully half the car, and each has a theme based on a movie star who was popular during the heyday of train travel. I had the occasion to stay at the Crowne Plaza when my company held its Annual Meeting there and found it to be very pleasant in other ways as well. The food catered into our meetings was quite good in both quality and variety -- several notches up from your standard banquet fare. The service in the bar off the lobby was also excellent, despite the throngs of my thirsty colleagues who congregated there after the day's activities. And the staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. Finally, the Crowne Plaza is close to several popular downtown venues, including Lucas Oil Stadium and Conseco Fieldhouse. All in all, a place worth visiting if you have occasion to be in downtown Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But Noisy”
Reviews.Author: midwestkissinger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to many great restaurants, bars, and shopping. Hotel staff was very nice. The people in the room next to us kept sitting out in the hallway and were extremely loud. The walls in the hotel rooms are paper thin and you can definitely hear the train come through. Not bad for the location and price though.

Reviews.Title: “What an interesting hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Meli_Montreal
Reviews.Content: I have always loved staying at the Crown Plaza chain, because of its service and the rooms. Crown Plaza Indianapolis offers similar qualities to its other chain hotels. The location is great and the staffs were very friendly. The room was quite spacious. The hotel is located in the historical Union Station, which makes it architecturally more interesting than others. The location of the swimming pool is also very interesting, right in the middle of first floor. I would not recommend dining at the hotel restaurant though. The food was mediocre and you can easily find many great restaurant 5 minutes walking distance from the hotels. Another word of caution for someone who has trouble sleeping at night, since the hotel is located right at the train station, you can hear train passing by. It is definitely not loud, unless you're very sensitive. It definitely did not bother me at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: popeye0987
Reviews.Content: The staff was fantastic. Everyone was friendly and accommodating. Parking was convenient and although it was $25 for valet parking they will get your car in and out over and over in 24 hours for just $25. They never complained when we asked for the car 7 times in 24 hours. Room was clean and well maintained. Everything is close enough to drive in minutes. Baseball, basketball and football all within minutes. The in house restaurant is very good, clean and the staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed , and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: enjoytravel
Reviews.Content: Great historic hotel, we enjoyed our "girlfriend getaway". The "ghosts"-- statue replicas of those whom may have traveled the rails "in the historic day" added charm to our overall hotel stay. Building seemed clean and kept up. Neat "feel" to the place. We were in an Executive double room, which are all on the ground floor. this concerned me at first, as i was afraid of noise since we were so close to the main lobby. No train noise or excessive noise to speak of. Could've used the earplugs that came with the room , but werent needed. A couple computers available to use if needed in area past the lobby. Enjoyed the sofas and conversation spaces in this center area as well. We walked by the train car rooms, those looked pretty neat from the outside, but couldn't see inside of them. blinds tightly closed and too high off ground. Bedding wonderful, most all of the help were great! except one of the daytime desk helpers.....one was very dry and not helpful, but the evening help was great, as was one of the daytime gentleman. Since PRiority club members, we were allowed to use club lounge inside of gated area. simple breakfast items,egg burrito, some fruit, coffee, Orange juice,cereal,pastries, (only one morning used it) we slept in too long one morning to take advantage of it. Great location to restaurants and Circle Center Mall. Walked to nearby White River State Park, and walked trail suggested by Bellman along the river and over couple bridges. Beautiful running/walking path. A nice feature offered by this hotel is if valet/bellman are available, they will take you and pick you back up within 15 block (sometimes more) radius, so don't have to walk if don't want to. Helped when raining.....Loved the valet parking service. Never ate at the hotel, so can't comment on their food. Loved walking downtown and up Meridian to Monument Circle. WE were pleasantly surprised at INDY's beautiful old buildings/architecture/Monuments and overall "ambiance". EVen horse and carriage rides available and red brick streets in the center of downtown. We would stay again at the Crowne, and visit more of INdy's sites and history. And this was in rainy, cold dreary weather! There would be even more to do during warm weather time! IF have the choice to stay downtown or the perimeter, my suggestion would be to stay downtown, so you don't have to bother with driving, and parking. So lovely to be able to walk places and get rides if tired of walking or inclement weather.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: twincatmom
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 4 nights to visit family that moved to Indianapolis. The location was great! Walking distance to great restaurants (The Ram was awesome!) and Monument Circle (The Chocolate Factory, yum!) We walked to the Canal and took some beautiful pictures along the canal and the White River with the fall folliage. The parking is a bit pricey, so be prepared. The service was good, and if you are a priority club member (easy to sign up at www.holidayinn.com) you get a complimentary breakfast each morning (Mon-Sat) in the Executive Club area. It was pretty good: egg burritos, muffins, fruit, toast, bagels, etc. The only thing I would have done differently is stay in the Train Car room. Our room was on the back end of the hotel, which had a great view of the new Lucas Oil Stadium (for the Colts), but also the train tracks! We heard the whistles and felt the rumbles all night. The atmosphere is nice, actually built inside the old train station, with statues randomly placed around. I would not pay the published rate, but if you are a AAA member, can get a government rate, or some other discount, than it is a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our train car room!”
Reviews.Author: ladyh90066
Reviews.Content: I am originally from Indiana and took my boyfriend back for a few days to see where I come from. I don't have any family/friends left in Indianapolis, so needed a special place to stay and this was IT! The refurbished train cars are so great -- luxurious with still keeping the train car feel. We stayed in number 26 and I would recommend staying on the outside of the building so your train car windows look out of other windows toward the city -- if you stay in an interior train car, your windows look out on other hotel rooms -- definitely not as fun! There was a fridge in the unit which was much appreciated, the bed was deliciously comfy and they even provide a restful sleep cd to help drown out any train sound (I hear a tiny rumble about 11:30 pm, but I was still awake and I doubt if it would have wakened me). We had dinner at the restaurant on site -- nothing special, but convenient. If we would have had more energy, we could have walked to several places nearby (the location is great). We ate room service breakfast and that was really good. I enjoyed a 9 pm swim and hot tub (pool at hot tub are indoors and very peaceful the night we were there -- a Wednesday). The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is that my boyfriend was a little disappointed -- only because our train car room was "too nice" -- he expected it to be more authentic, I guess!! ;-) I would definitely go back and stay for a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Attended Wedding There, Best Ever Service, Fantastic 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: mightythor101
Reviews.Content: We had a wedding in Indy this past weekend, reception hall was phenomenal, waiting staff was fantastic, our waiter worked our breakfast from 6am, through the entire reception, which ended at midnight, then he was back at our breakfast at 8am! When does that guy and his other workers sleep!? Recognized many other staff too. Rooms were great, service was great, place was spotless, yes, there is valet parking, and i did worry about putting one of those guys behind MY hooptie's wheel........tried to get them to upgrade upon return, but ended up with my same 'ol clunker.... I noticed the last person's comment, grumbling about the parking,.....It's right downtown, and parking is a huge issue in large cities.....even Indianapolis.....of course it's not free.... We had many rooms, and i heard of no complaints from anyone of our 200 + people group............. Their service to us will be remembered by all who were there, the reception hall was decorated perfectly, meals were fantastic, dance floor was great, sound system worked great, the bar staff was more then professional, and the martini fountain was superb. the only complaint I, or anyone in our group would/could make, was that the lights on the floor in the reception hall were hard to step around, several people at our table stumbled, but no one fell, going around them in the edges of the room. Definitely not anything to really worry about, but they probably do need to figure out a way to fix that issue maybe. Mount them into the floor maybe.... Other then that, it could not have been better in any way, shape, or form........... It rates 5 STARS FROM EVERYONE IN OUR GROUP, I'LL SEE TO IT THAT MORE PEOPLE POST COMMENTS!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: justb54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza hotel on August 30, 2008 for one night. When I booked the room I was told the rate was $117.00. This is the government discount. When we arrived, parking was either valet for $24.00 a night or public parking down the street in a parking garage for $20.00 a night. Nothing was mentioned about the parking when I booked the room. Our room was on the first floor by a gate that went to "executive club members". DId not sleep all night due to guests going in and out of this gate. I wondered why we had a sleep CD, ear plugs, and eye mask on the bed when we entered the room. Now, I know why!!! We had been at the NHRA Drag races all day and was looking forward to a relaxing evening. Did not happen. Stay cost $155.00. Not worth it and will never stay there again. We stayed at Quality Inn the night before for $80.00 and it was a much more enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Indy5
Reviews.Content: As an extra perk to the quirky convention I was attending, I decided to stay in one of the vintage train cars instead of a regular room. Although I'd heard that they were noisy and narrow, I couldn't find any fault with them at all. The entire hotel is very pretty, exceptionally clean and actually really quiet for being housed in a train station. I can't say that I was bothered by the train noise even once. I felt the vibrations as they passed by but that was about it. Another really neat thing about the Crowne Plaza is that it's physically attached to the Historic Union Station which is absolutely beautiful and a delight to explore. Staff at the hotel bent over backwards to make sure everything was perfect for my stay even though they were booked solid and had their hands full with accommodating thousands of Gencon attendees. I definitely plan to return next year if not sooner.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on Hotwire, nice, a little creepy”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandBeachBoy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely interesting. My room was kind of fun because it was sort of a room in the middle of the lobby area. It was fun to leave my curtain open and people watch and let people look at me if they so desired. The train car area was a littel creepy and there were very few people around. It was necessary to get there to get to the workout facility, which was adequate. I liked the hotel a lot, especially with the deal on Hotwire. It was clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Totally unique, special hotel, captures the spirit of the place”
Reviews.Author: indianatrails
Reviews.Content: Unlike so many downtown hotels, tremendous effort went into making the experience here very context-sensitive so that the visitor is able to get a taste of the actual place and its heritage. This is not just a cookie-cutter downtown hotel. Everything was absolutely first-class, including the room, ambience, pool, staff, valet, food, etc. The kids had a wonderful time and there was lots for them to explore. The train car room was surprisingly spacious, tastefully decorated (all cars have their own unique decor and even a name), and strategically placed skylighting made it cheery during the day. The staff went out of their way to accommodate us and offered to valet-park our bicycles, which we brought with us. The manager (Marco) and his staff were warm and gracious. This was truly a special place and an unexpected find.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: writergeek313
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on a room at the Crowne Plaza through Hotwire, and the location was great for me, since I was traveling to and from Indianapolis by train. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I didn't know until arriving that the hotel is part of a working train station; I had thought it was a separate building right next door. They provide ear plugs, an eye mask, and a relaxation CD, but I didn't need any of those. I could feel a vibration when trains passed through, but not enough to disturb me. My room was very nice. The linens were top of the line, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was spacious. The only thing I disliked was that mine was a corner room that faced the main hallway, right across from the gym, and my window looked out into the hallway rather than outside. This made the room feel a bit less private. Overall, the hotel and its staff were great, and I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and outdated.”
Reviews.Author: cubsblue
Reviews.Content: I like the Crowne Plaza chain overall but the last two I have stayed in are really showing their age. We stayed here for a night away for our anniversary. I asked the front desk clerk on arrival for a quiet room. She stuck us right next to the railroad. Every time a train went by (which was at least one every hour) our room shook and the noise was ridiculous. The manager gave us 2000 priority points the next morning but in my opinion we should have received the stay free as I am still trying to catch up on the sleep missed that night. The rooms need to be updated. This motel is something from the early 90's and desperately lacks amenities. We waited 20 minutes for help with our bags on check out despite the fact that there was no one else needing help at the time. I had to call the bell desk twice. Their service has definitely gone downhill over the last few months. I will avoid it in the future.

Reviews.Title: “No outside windows”
Reviews.Author: TioPablo
Reviews.Content: Cool concept but a bit run down. Staff are very friendly. There are no outside windows in any rooms (all face the interior of the old train station)so you may feel like you are doing a four day bit in solitary, as we did. The rooms by the pool ( we moved) are a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty neat experience”
Reviews.Author: signalten
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Crowne Plaza and found it to be a pretty neat experence. Self Parking was a little confusing. Next time I would opt to park valet. Our check in was prompt and the staff were friendly. We thought the Pullman car rooms were interesting. We wanted to stay in one but we weren't sure if a a pack and play would fit in one. We opted for a regular room and we were right by the pool. The pool was small but clean and it had two jacuzzis. Our room was clean but the carpeting by the door was unraveling. The beds were okay but the eye mask and relaxation CD were a nice touch. The location was nice and it was only a few block walk to circle centre. If I am every in Indianapolis again I probably would stay here agan.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: IndyLJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night to celebrate our first anniversary earlier this week. We live in Indianapolis, but we didn't have time to go too far away and decided to stay at a nice local hotel just for something different. I found out I could get a special rate for the Crowne Plaza through my employer, and I thought the traincar idea was interesting. I thought it could be a little cheesy and I was a little put off by some of the reviews here, but we decided to go ahead and try it since it'd just be one night. We weren't disappointed at all! All of the staff were so friendly and helpful, especially the woman at the front desk who helped us check in. She was so warm and welcoming, and she called after we got into the room to make sure we were happy with it. We stayed in the first traincar room, which was decorated in a Charlie Chaplin theme (all of the rooms are themed by '20s movie stars, which is fun). You can tell that it's been awhile since these rooms were renovated, but hey, nothing can seem brand new forever. Everything was still in very good condition and exceptionally clean. The bed was large and very comfortable, with nice, quality bedding and lots of pillows. I was happy to see a real duvet instead of the thin, stiff, almost crunchy-feeling "comforters" that many (sometimes more expensive) hotels always seem to have - I HATE those. Yes, the traincar rooms are a little small, but you should kind of expect that since it's...well, a traincar. We still had plenty of room. We only once noticed a little bit of vibration from a train coming in, but it wasn't a problem. As others mentioned, they do remind you that the station is still "active" and they provide earplugs and a sleep CD in case the sound bothers you. We actually thought the rumbling was funny more than anything. We saw all of these things as little "quirks" that just enhanced the novelty of staying in a renovated train station. We had SUCH a good time there. I've already recommended it to some of my friends here. P.S. - Another reviewer noted that the staff told him there was a Cheesecake Factory nearby but it was actually 25 min. away - I'm guessing that the staff member was thinking of the Old Spaghetti Factory, which is in fact just down the street. Plus, there are plenty of great, UNIQUE restaurants within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Has all the basics with not alot of frills”
Reviews.Author: meo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short 2-night stay at the Crowne Plaza formerly a Holiday Inn, so I am told. From what has been posted about this hotel, I was somewhat skeptical to stay there, but had little choice since much of everywhere else was booked. My experience was actually pleasant, the room was clean, the evenings were quiet, and the vibrations from the trains could be felt but nothing too bothersome. I am a light sleeper but didn’t need the earplugs or CD that they furnished to stay asleep. Since it’s a part of Union Station, it does have a unique charm and interesting architecture. My room was very close to the gym, which was equipped with a couple cardio machines, a weight machine, but no free weights. I would recommend staying on this side of the hotel. The hotel is located across from the ice arena and easy walking distance to all the downtown attractions. It’s a 3 Star accommodation, so if you’re looking for more luxury and pampering, I suggest the Conrad Hotel or the Westin, which are also quite close. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty!”
Reviews.Author: Ferro1001
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving, the area in front of the hotel looks terrible and gives off a uncomfortable feeling. The hotel is alright, but when entering the room it was not clean. Dust was thick, the hair dryer was so gross that it looked like someone wiped ear wax all down the cord. We called for room service and just asked for a fork, we waited over 1/2 hour nobody showed, we had to call down again. The check in expereince was less than friendly, and then upon calling the hotel to ask if they had a cheesecake factory we were told "yes, right across the street" which in fact is almost 25 minutes away. Just terrible guest service, was not pleasant at all.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ckdjr60301
Reviews.Content: My partner and I traveled to Indianapolis on personal business. At the last minute, I was able to get a great rate bidding on Priceline. The Crowne Plaza Union Station was really a unique hotel. The hotel is set in historic Union Station. I wish I would have had more time to spend wandering the hotel. This hotel would be great for families with children. My room was on the third floor (room 369) directly above the pool. There was noice from children playing in the pool, which was somewhat annoying when I was trying to take a quick nap in the late afternoon. Though it wasn't a big deal, it was the only unpleasant thing about my stay. The service in the hotel was superb. The people were genuine, friendly and accomodating. Valet service was $24/day with in and out privileges. The room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was small, but clean and ok. We were advised at check-in that Union Station is still "active" and we may hear trains going in and out. They gave us ear plugs and a CD to listen to to rest, eye mask and a small lavender spray. I believe I may have heard a train around 11:00pm, but the sound was so faint that I can't confirm it. I would definitely return to this hotel again. I would, however, request to have a room away from the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Charm-A Unique Experience”
Reviews.Author: missmuffett66
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews of this hotel, I decided I needed to post my own opinion. I stayed, on a completely booked weekend, with 4 teenage girls and the moms. We loved the hotel!! We had train car rooms and loved the experience. We were on the "quiet side" of the train so we didn't have the noise of the working train station. I have told many since that weekend that this was the quietest hotel room I have ever stayed in. No hallway noise, etc. since we basically had steel walls. Occasionally there was a gentle vibration from trains coming in, but nothing kept us awake. The rooms were all unique and offered a very different hotel experience. They are narrow (after all it is a train car!), but that is part of the whole experience. Don't take a train car room if you want a traditional hotel room. The front desk staff actually let us look at the rooms first before deciding! I would recommend 2 adults max per room (the beds are smallish). 4 teenagers were perfectly content with 2 double beds, but 4 moms needed 2 separate rooms. The bathrooms on the train were actually bigger than in the regular executive rooms. The hotel is conveniently located near great restaurants, Pan Am Plaza for ice skating, and Circle Center Mall for shopping. Parking was $20 overnight, which is a little pricy for Indy-we couldn't find street parking which can be tricky since there are limited hours for free parking. We will definitely use this hotel again and would recommend it to others who want something unusual.

Reviews.Title: “LOUD and poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: Jaelynn_8
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to stay at the Crowne Plaza Union Station in Indianapolis, but upon arrival I realized that my expectations were set a bit too high. One would think that since we were paying $140 per night, the experience would be a bit more enjoyable. The rooms were very small and a bit worn down. The furniture had been worn in places, however the bed was absolutely wonderful. We stayed on the second floor with a window facing the atrium/pool area. BIG PROBLEM here... It is so noisy because the pool is literally in the middle of all of the rooms, not to mention there was a children's cheerleading convention in town. My boyfriend and I were exhausted from traveling, and could not wait to go for a relaxing swim or have a soak in the spa. Neither of these were an option because there were literally at least 35 kids in the swimming pool, and 16 people in the spa, many under the age of 12 even though the sign posted says that anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an adult. (?) So we not only could not swim or enjoy the spa, but we also had to endure the ridiculous screaming and yelling of kids until 10 PM. NOT relaxing in the least. I called management and asked if there would be any way to have the pool stay open for adults for about 20 to 30 minutes after the kids left. I explained the situation and told him we can't even get IN the pool for one, and the noise in our room was unbearable. One gentleman I spoke with was very nice and said he would have to check on it and would call me back. No one returned my call. I called down again to follow up and spoke to Terry, who was the manager on duty. He proceeded to tell me in a rude and condescending manner that he would not be opening the pool up for people who were unable to use it during that time. Something about a contract which I understand, but I was surprised when he did not offer any solution to the problem. Apparently, this is a pretty common thing. They do provide you with ear plugs, a sleep mask and a CD, but the CD player did not even work properly. Of course, promptly at nine a.m., the cheerleaders were in the pool again, screaming and yelling. It was so loud that we called down and asked for another set of earplugs (They only gave us one initially). The concierge brought a bag of random toiletries; several packets of coffee and condiments. I did not feel ike they were being very professional whatsoever. I felt that we could have had a much nicer time somewhere else... defintely somewhere quieter! I am not a complainer, but this was terrible. However, one good thing was the hotel shuttle service. They offered to drive us a few blocks up to a blues bar and restuarant (The Slippery Noodle) because the weather was so cold. I thought that was very considerate. It was actually the only time during our stay that I felt they were trying to make our stay enjoyable. That was about it, though! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to relax, swim, or sleep in!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but could use some housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Indianafarmerswife
Reviews.Content: The lobby is first rate, the staff pleasant, and shuttle service prompt, but our "4-star" room was disappointing. The carpeting was pieced and raveling. The bath mat stained and chair had a "messy" spot. But worst, obviously, no one checks behind the door, but the guests. It had not been swept for months. The dust and fuzz was layered on the floor and wall in our third floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Break from Work Travel!”
Reviews.Author: jetsettinallie
Reviews.Content: After having a not-so-great stay in another Indy hotel while on business, our client suggested we stay at the Crowne Plaza - competitive prices and better experience. He was right! The hotel is very clean and comfortable. The front desk staff is quite helpful. There is a valet for parking; usually quite quick but of course the day we are running late it took them over 20 minutes on a quiet early weekday morning to bring us our car. There are a few dining choices within the hotel - the breakfast buffet is plentiful, tasty and well maintained. We had appetizers and drinks in the hotel bar and found it clean, the staff pleasant and quite accommodating. Each time I stayed there, I stayed on a different floor. I found the main floor near the pool to be extremely noisy at all hours of the evening (horrible acoustics) but the other rooms fine. All are small, but well-laid out, very very comfortable beds, quite clean. I loved the sleep package that came with the room - a guided sleep CD, eye mask and ear plugs. The location is convenient to shopping and most Indy city attractions. The staff is helpful in providing suggestions on where to visit. When we arrived we were offered the option of free Haagen Daz ice cream or milk and cookies to be delivered to our room as a late-night snack - very fun feature. There are two computers and a printer in the elevator area on the main floor which was very convenient. Had no issues with accessing the Internet from the room. The decor is a bit odd - white plater full-sized statues of people with real leather luggage are around the lobby and there is an old traincar on display (and I believe available to sleep in).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: pntballkrm
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews about the noise from the trains i expected the worst.......well it was far from it. When we checked in the guy at the desk said he would put us on the "quiet side" of the hotel. Our room was on the first floor and our entire time there we did not hear a train once. The hotel room was nice and roomy. Very clean!!!!! The only downside to this hotel was that the parking was VERY expensive for the location. Parking is $23.00 a day. This was very high considering there are parking garages within a 30 second walk that are only $8 a day. The breakfast buffet was awesome! Any kind of meat and eggs pancakes etc were avaliable fresh to order. and it was only 9.99 a day. I would deffinately reccomend this hotel but i would drive around the block and park in another lot. Keep up the good work Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Not super impressed: loud rooms, shabby interior”
Reviews.Author: TravelSchmavel
Reviews.Content: I had just come from staying in the Marriott in downtown Indy to this hotel. They are the same star rating: 3 and booked both on Priceline for $50/night. This hotel was far inferior. While the location is really good, easy walking distance to everything central even in 20 degree weather, the hotel is in desperate need of a renovation. The fact that it's in a train station is fun and the kids really enjoyed seeing the rooms in train cars, but it is loud throughout the night. They do give you earplugs, a CD, and a night mask, but I still couldn't sleep. Moved rooms to the third floor from the second on night two and that helped some. The windows face an open atrium in the hotel instead of outside which add extra noise. The interior is very shabby, carpet worn, bathrooms from the 80's or so, bu the beds are nice. Stay away from the restaurant, very run down and much better choices within walking distance. Overall: Okay for Priceline, but not if you pay full price. When it is renovated, it will be better I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, A Little Worn Down”
Reviews.Author: DaytonTravelers
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza is located in an old (but still functioning) train station so it has plenty of character. The hotel is directly across the street from the RCA Dome, diagonally located from the new Lucas Oil stadium ((still under construction) and just a block from the Circle City mall. It is very convenient. We stayed in an old passenger train car. We had always wanted to stay in the train cars, but now that we did, we won't do it again. The car was very long and narrow, it was only a little wider than the beds were long. Each car is named after a famous American, ours was the John Philip Sousa car so it had a patriotic theme inside. I think a nice touch would have been to have a short description of the famous American's contributions. Although the room had character, it was very worn looking. The carpets were unraveling at the edge. All the wood trim was very scuffed up and looked quite dirty. The bathroom door had stains that looked like something (coffee or soda) had spilled on the door, but was never cleaned. We have stayed in regular rooms at this hotel in the past. They were much nicer and clean. We don't regret staying in train since we've always wanted to stay there, but in the future, we'll ask for a regular room. Anyone staying at this hotel should know that it is still a functioning train station and trains do run through the building every day. We didn't really notice the trains in the regular rooms, but they seemed very loud when we stayed in the train cars. Maybe it's because the train cars are directly above the train tracks lower in the building.

Reviews.Title: “very interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: selenajon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed just to get away for a night. We booked on priceline, and got our room for $55. We really enjoyed our stay. The hotel was nice, and very interesting. If you are a train lover, this is the place to stay! The rooms were very nice and spacious. I am really pickiy about neatness, and cleanliness, and being comfortable in my room. The room passed all the tests. It was neat to stay in the interior of the hotel, our room overlooked the pool area. Also, by staying in the interior, you avoid the noise of the trains passing by. We were not disturbed at all by the train. We felt a little rummbling, but nothing major. We were disappointed that the hot tub was not working that night, we were looking forward to that after a long day at a convention. The hotel is in a great location. Of course, being downtown, you have to pay up to $20 for parking in the ajacent garage. Valet may be better, because it is about the same price with "in and out priviledges." All and all, we really enjoyed our stay and would stay again. Oh!, one last thing, the beds were very nice and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Train Noise Wasn't the Problem”
Reviews.Author: IzZzalot
Reviews.Content: I was in Indy last month for a conferance across the street at the Omni. The hotel was in a great location, close to the convention center, the NCAA, and the stadiums. The mall is block away and there are a lot of great brewpubs and other restuarants within walking distance. If you are coming from the airport, use Carey Limousines. $12 each way gets you either a sedan or a limo. It was actually cheaper then a cab and definitly much nicer. The hotel itself was as expected. My king room was very large with enough room for me to get around. My room was interior, so I had a view of the indoor pool. The TV selection was nice and the shower was phenominal. The train noise that people talk about wasn't really a problem in this room, probably because it was interior. I also grew up a couple blocks away from train tracks and I still live relatively close, so I'm also pretty used to it. But what drove me nuts was the hallway noise. Doors slamming, people talking, etc. all night long. I dealt with it, but it was annoying. When I got home my wife also told me I smelled like diesel, which I thought may have been the plane, but everything in my bag had the smell too, so it was probably the hotel. No big deal though. Just for reference, the bed and pillows were quite uncomforable, so if you can bring your own pillow, i'd recommend it.
